loans.name: Sohoueto Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOHOUETO est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Viviane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Viviane est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Viviane est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Séverin. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Viviane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de répondre efficacement aux besoins de sa famille, Viviane vend depuis cinq ans des biscuits en gros  et de façon secondaire des produits cosmétiques à son domicile ou par le système de distribution. Viviane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Viviane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement SOHOUETO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO is a group of thirteen people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s second time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

The group’s representative is Viviane, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Viviane is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver named Severin and they have three dependent children, all in school. Viviane lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, she started selling biscuits wholesale as well as cosmetic products five years ago, from her home and through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise at a market of Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Viviane is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group SOHOUETO. This first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Bidzina

texts.en:
Bidzina is 53-year-old farmer. He lives in a small village in the Khobi District with his family: wife Rusiko, 28-year-old son, daughter-in-law and 4-year-old granddaughter. Bidzina’s son works in the local division of the Security Police. He gets a monthly salary.

Bidzina and Rusiko lead the agricultural business of the family. They run a family-owned small dairy and pig farm. In particular, there are 6 milk cows and a pig on the farm. Bidzina and Rusiko produce traditional West Georgian cheese and sell it on the local open market. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns 3 hectares of agricultural land where maize is grown. Bidzina uses part of the harvested maize for feeding the domestic animals and the other part is sold on the local open market as well. The family members are busy during the whole day, especially in spring and summer periods, with seasonal agricultural work. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Bidzina requested credit for renting a tractor for tilling the land. Also part of the credit he will use for purchasing fuel for the tractor. After tilling the land, he will sow maize. Bidzina and Rusiko will work hard during the whole spring and summer to get a good harvest and to sell it at a convenient price. The family will use received profit for financing family daily needs.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fuel for tilling the land

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband – Irakli and her parents-in-law (pensioners). Irakli serves in the country’s army forces. Maya leads the agricultural business for her family and her parents-in-law help her. In particular, the family owns a dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Maya and her mother-in-law produce cheese. They sell on average 40 kg of cheese each month on the local open market. Along with the abovementioned, the family has a greenhouse with the area of 450 sq. meters. They grow cucumbers and tomatoes in the greenhouse during the whole year.  The harvested vegetables are sold on the local open market as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 900 Laris, including the pensions of Maya’s parents-in-law. 

Maya requested credit to fix their greenhouse.  The existing polyethylene cover is already torn. Maya will purchase a new one and also change damaged wooden pillars. After the renovation, the greenhouse will keep the needed temperature and give a better quality and bigger harvest to the family. Their income from the sales will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married and has four children.

Estela owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns 9,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Estela joined GDMPC.

Estela is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Antonio Smtih

texts.es:
Antonio es joven muy trabajador, es padre de un hijo de 13 años por el cual trabaja mucho y trabaja para enseñarle que con dedicación y esfuerzo todo es posible; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y también porque se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Antonio le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, así como también pasar un tiempo con su hijo y sobre todo ayudarlo con sus tareas de la escuela cuando se puede, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche” . Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Día a Día Antonio trabaja en su negocio de reparación de vehículos, en especial camiones, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 12 clientes en el día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y siempre los clientes los recomiendan.

Antonio mesta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una gata lagarto, que es una herramienta para bajada de caja, asimismo herramientas como destornilladores, llave estilson, entre otros; así el podrá seguir trabajando día a día y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: Tener un taller mas grande”.
texts.en:
Antonio is a hardworking young man and the father of a 13-year-old son. For this reason, he works very hard so that he can demonstrate to his son that everything is possible through effort and dedication. His home is located in the District of Parcona, which is known for its warm weather and the development of its agriculture and livestock businesses. When he has free time, Antonio enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors in his neighborhood. However, he also likes spending time with his son, but most of all, helping him with his homework when he is able. One of his favorite dishes that he likes to eat is the flavorful "ceviche" (marinated seafood). Antonio's parents had few financial resources, so he only has a high school education. He would have liked very much to have studied mechanical engineering.

Each day, Antonio works in his business of repairing vehicles, especially trucks. He works approximately 10 hours and is able to attend up to 12 customers in a day. Antonio believes he is doing well in his business because he is responsible and his customers always recommend him. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance that will be given to him, he will be able to buy a hydraulic jack (a piece of equipment used for raising and lowering the body of a vehicle), as well as tools such as screwdrivers, pipe wrenches, and other items. This will enable him to continue working day after day. Antonio strives to accomplish his greatest dream of having a larger repair shop.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic jack, pipe wrenches, screwdrivers, and other items.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is 60 years old. He lives in Martvili District, West Georgia. Yuri works as a taxi driver. He provides transportation service to the Martvili District population. Yuri’s wife – Liana and their 32-year-old son run the agricultural business for the family. They have a milk cow. Liana produces cheese and sells it in the village. Liana also grows bay trees and maize on the family-owned 0.8 hectare of land. They sell the harvested maize and bay leaves locally to retailers. The total average monthly income for the family is 500 Laris. 

Yuri requested credit to set up a bread bakery. With the received credit he will build a Georgian bread bakery. He will use his savings to purchase wood and flour to bake traditional Georgian bread. His son and a hired baker will bake the bread and sell it from the bakery. According to Yuri’s estimations, the bakery will be profitable as there is no similar one in the village. The income for the family will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: open a bakery

loans.name: Nedda Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nedda, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, 5 mayores de edad y dos de 11 y 7 años los mismos estudian en escuela, tres de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudar a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar,  para esto ella realiza los créditos para que él  utilice el crédito  en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa y otros artículos, nos cuenta que él se desplaza a otros lugares en su carro a vender sus productos, mientras que ella realiza quehaceres domésticos en una casa de la localidad pero también en su ratos libres vende productos de Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Es así como ellos reúnen lo necesario para poder sacar adelante a su familia, él lleva más de 20 años en este negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatos, ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener  un almacén donde su marido pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton.  The canton is known by its nickname, "The Sultana of Coffee", because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people. 

This is where we meet Nedda, age 46.  She is married, and they have five grown children and two children, ages 11 and 7, who go to school.  Three of their children still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good wife, who tries to help her husband with the heavy responsibility of the household.  In order to do so she gets loans that he uses in his business.  He sells shoes, clothes, and other items.  She tells us that he travels to other places in his car to sell his products.  While he does this she does housework in a house in the area.  However, in her free time she also sells Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).

This is how they join together to be able to do what is needed to get their family ahead.  She has had this business for 20 years, and it is going quite well for her.

She will use the loan to buy shoes, clothes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products.  She has been in her communal bank for 12 years.  She likes it because of the help  from the loans.

Her dream is to have a store where her husband could sell his products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products.

loans.name: Silviano

texts.en:
When Silviano installs his new Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, the family will be able to produce thousands of liters of organic fertilizer per week for their orchards and greenhouses, treat their animal waste, and produce biogas for use in the kitchen.  Silviano has spent his life integrating family farming techniques that encourage strong bonds to "Mother Earth", and with the use of a biodigester he can further increase these bonds within his family's "productive circle".  

His son Eric, an agricultural engineer, teaches local individuals with developmental disorders how to take care of animals and crops in addition to tending to the family farm.  Hortencia, Eric's wife, is an industrial engineer who also maintains the farm.  

Silviano is a leader in his community and has always stressed the importance of using sustainable farming techniques, publishing editorials that encourage his community to implement vegetable gardens, small chicken coops, and other small-scale production methods.  He has seen the effects of climate change within his community and wants to use and encourage technologies that will help farmers grow crops and raise animals while minimizing their impact on the environment.

loans.use: To purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a single woman with a single child who is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a salon and has been doing so for the last three years. She also sells clothes as her side business, where she sells clothes door-to-door mostly to her neighbors. Seasonality is her major drawback and she dreams of opening a boutique in the future. With the loan of 50,000 KES, she intends to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: El señor Raúl, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual labora como comerciante, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen hijos a su  cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y sobre todo apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios primarios hasta que lleguen a ser una carrera profesional , don Raúl desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar las tierras , el tiene una plantillo de piña , pero esta carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios ya que por problemas de recursos económico no le puede brindar una   buena mantención , lo cual necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para sacar en un futuro una mejor producción  de calidad , ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para poder llevar el pan de cada día a sus hijos .
texts.en:
Señor Raúl, his wife, and children live in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She runs a business to help him with household expenses. They hope in the future to improve their standard of living and above all help their children get an education and a good job.

Raúl’s parents taught him from childhood how to be a farmer. He grows pineapples, but the land lacks fertilizer and other agricultural supplies. Because he doesn’t have the money, Raúl hasn’t been able to look after the land well so he is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer etc. to enable him to have better production in the future. The  pineapples are his only source of income to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista – Tarma.

Ella sola supo sacar adelante a sus hijos trabajando en el campo, ya que la agricultura es su principal actividad económica. Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a esta labor tan cansada, pero todo lo hace por sus hijos, ya que son su razón de lucha. 
Vilma siembra arveja, habas, maíz y papa, los cuales cuida constantemente. Su rutina inicia en la madrugada, sus cultivos se ubican a media hora de su casa, por eso debe caminar mucho para atender sus sembríos.  Además posee animales como; vacas y toros, los que pasta mientras atiende sus cultivos. “Me gusta lo que hago, con la leche de las vacas preparo quesos y los vendo a mis vecinos y conocidos”, menciona. 
Ella ha pasado por momentos críticos, uno de ellos es la falta de capital, por esa razón quebró su negocio de abarrotes, pero con el tiempo y sus ahorros pudo adquirir terrenos propios donde realiza sus actividades agrícolas con tranquilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP. Por lo que espera el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otra parte, se siente a gusto como parte de su grupo porque el trabajo es solidario y responsable.
Vilma invertirá el dinero en la compra de tres bolsas de semillas de arveja. Lo restante será para pagar el servicio de los peones que contratará para la siembra.
texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old, single, and has four children. She lives with two of them in her own home, which is located in the town of Bellavistsa - Tarma.

Knowing that she must help her children get ahead, Vilma works alone in the fields since farming is her main business activity. She has been performing this tiring work for more than 20 years, but she does this for her children, who are her reason for pressing forward. Vilma grows peas, beans, corn, and potatoes. She provides her crops with constant care. Her routine begins at dawn because the crops are located 30 minutes from her house and she must walk a great distance to get to them. She also owns animals, such as cows and bulls, and allows them to graze while she attends to her crops. "I enjoy what I do. With the milk from the cows, I am able to make cheeses that I can sell to my neighbors and friends," she mentions. Vilma is going through a critical time since she lacks capital. For this reason, she had to close down her grocery business. Over time and with her savings, she was able to acquire her own farmland where she could grow her crops without worry.

Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor de Muruhuay" and this will be her second loan with MFP. She expects the financial support will help her continue to meet her goals. Vilma feels comfortable working with her group because their work results in team-building and responsibility. She will invest the money in three sacks of pea seeds. The rest will be used to pay for the services of workers who will be hired to do the planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and to hire workers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 27 years of age, married, and has two children.  She resides and owns a tailoring business in Kabarnet town. She has been in her tailoring business for one year and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

Mercy is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy sewing materials such as threads, needles, and clothe materials. She plans to use  the anticipated profits to increase her sewing materials and to sustain her family.  Her dream is to be able to sustain and expand her tailoring business so she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as threads, needles, and clothe materials.

loans.name: Tania Justina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tania, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 25 y 13 años de edad, con ella vive un nieto de 5 años, su hijo menor estudia en colegio  y su nieto en escuela.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y con esto poder salir adelante con sus hijos se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos de todo tipo y tamaños, tiene  un pequeño puesto el mismo que instala en una de las calles de la ciudad donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, conocido como la Bahía de Jipijapa,  ella trabaja allí todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00, vende solo al contado y a veces a crédito pero solo a clientes que son muy conocidos y confiables. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y a Cuenca lugar donde consigue más barato. Ella tiene más de 23 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, gracia a esto ha podido sacra adelante a sus hijos ella sola.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el Banco.

Su sueño es tener un buen local en el centro  de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton.  The canton is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people. 

This is where we meet Tania, age 48.  She is the single mother of two children, ages 25 and 13.  Her five year old grandson lives with her.  Her younger son goes to middle school, and her grandson goes to elementary school.

In order to earn a living to use to be able to get ahead with her children, she devotes herself to commerce.  She sells all types and sizes of shoes.  She has a small stand that is set up on one of the streets in the city where there are lots of merchants offering their products.  It is known as the “Bahía de Jipipapa” (Jipipapa Bay), and she works there every day from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She sells only for cash.  However, sometimes she sells on credit, but only to customers who are well-known and reliable.

She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise, and she goes to Cuenca where she gets merchandise for a lower price.  She has 23 years in this business, and it is going very well for her.  Thanks to this she has been able to get her children ahead by herself.

She will use this loan to buy all types of shoes.  She has been in her communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because of the help that is given in the bank

Her dream is to have a good place in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making snacks and viands like rice cakes and afritada.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is married with two children. She is 38 years old and lives in Viray Molicay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Meriam owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years and earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 5,300 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Meriam has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC for three years. In the future, Meriam's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a single woman with single child who is enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for the past three years, and she aspires to open a shop in the future. Her primary customers include local residents. High transport cost is her major challenge, and school fees and rent are her greatest monthly expenses. Selina plans to use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine is 28 years old, married to Oscar and blessed with four children (a 19 year old, seven year old twins and a four year old). She owns a restaurant, a business she ventured in four years ago. Maurine earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a bale of baking flour, 10 litres of cooking oil and 40kgs of rice to use in her restaurant. The profit she earns from this business will help her increase her stock and pay her children's school fees. She hopes to invest more in her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of baking flour, 10 litres of cooking oil and 40kgs of rice to stock in her restaurant.

loans.name: Yixon

texts.es: Yixon de 24 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizzas, negocio que inició una vez recibió su liquidación de una empresa donde trabajaba y la invirtió en sus primeros activos fijos, como horno para hacer pizas y poco a poco adquirió otras herramientas. Así fue como organizó su negocio y teniendo una gran aceptación y logró muy pronto el crecimiento de sus ingresos. Día a día su clientela pregunta por productos que aun no tiene y por eso desea diversificar, acudiendo a un credikiva para lograrlo,  porque adicionará carnes al carbón, bollos de maíz entre otros productos y necesita comprar carne s en mayor volumen y adicionar a su infraestructura un asador de carne, con el cual saldrá al mercado en una de las temporadas de mayor volumen de ventas, como es el mes de Mayo, época de muchas celebraciones como el día de las madres, del padre, las secretarias y eventos religiosos diversos. Su meta mas adelante es tener un restaurante con gran variedad de comidas caribes e internacionales y su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr el cumplimiento de sus sueños y esto es lo que hará poco a poco con Kiva para continuar siendo mas exitoso.
texts.en:
Yixon, age 24, lives in the city of Cartagena and earns his living by preparing and selling pizzas. He started this business once he received his severance pay from the company where he worked and then he invested it in fixed assets, such as a pizza oven. Little by little, he acquired other pieces of equipment. This is how he organized his business, which has been well-received. Very soon, his revenues will start to grow.

Each day, his customers asks for products that he does not offer. Yixon wants to diversify, so he is applying for a Kiva loan in order to do this. He plans to add barbecued meats, corn muffins, and other products to his menu, but he needs to buy meat in large amounts and also add a meat grill to his existing infrastructure. Yixon hopes to accomplish this in time for one of the largest sales periods at the market, the month of May when many celebrations take place such as Mother's Day, Father's Day, Secretary's Day, and various religious events.

His goal moving forward is to own a restaurant that serves a wide variety of Caribbean and international foods. His greatest challenge is not having sufficient operating capital to fulfill his dreams. With the help of Kiva, Yixon will gradually continue to become more successful.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk and a meat grill.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mariana es originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 2 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad de vida independientes. Inicio  su actividad con la necesidad de generar ingresos para la manutención de su familia  a la edad de 36 años, comenzó elaborando pasteles de piña y queso después fue incrementando su pedido y también se incorporo a elaborar pasteles para boda y cumpleaños, este fue su segundo negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de carne pero dejo de realizarla para cuidar a sus hijos y dedicarles mas tiempo, en su negocio no le apoya nadie pues lo saca adelante sola, su producto lo vende en Granada tiene otros ingresos provenientes de su esposo que trabaja por su propia cuenta. Solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima tales como harina, Jalea, mantequilla,levadura, crema,huevos, colorantes el cual estima  este crédito le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en el mes de mayo  mes de las madre donde la mayoria de los  pasteles se hacen alusivos a la celebracion de las mamas y sobre todo podrá seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en: Mariana is from Granada.  She is married and the mother of two adult children who are living on their own.  She started her business because she needed to generate income to support her family.  At the age of 36, she began making pineapple and cheese cakes.  After her orders increased, she added wedding and birthday cakes.  This is her second business.  Previously, she sold meat but gave it up to care for her children and spend more time with them. No one helps her with her business so must get ahead on her own.  She sells her products in Granada and she has additional income from her husband who works on his own. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as wheat, jelly, butter, yeast, cream, eggs, and food coloring. She feels that this loan will help her to increase inventory and enable her to meet customer demand during the month of May as she makes most of her cakes for Mother’s Day.  Above all, she will be able to continue working in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as wheat, jelly, butter, yeast, cream, eggs, and food coloring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped-in water, and earns a living by running a boutique located in the local market. She dreams of expanding this business and hiring a few employees in the future, and joined Yehu to access funds that will help her boost her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Grace plans to use this loan for KSH 30,000 to buy clothing and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bebian

texts.en: Bebian is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Bebian is married and has two children. To make a living, Bebian owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community. Bebian has been in her business for 2 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Bebian joined GDMPC. Bebian is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia tiene 52 años, vive con Eduardo, con quien tiene 8 hijos, pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos (los de 19, 17 y 14 años). Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma.

A pesar de su edad, Felicia trabaja con esmero en el campo. La mayor parte de sus días los pasa cuidando sus terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papas, arvejas, habas, maíz, entre otros. Desde hace más de 30 años se dedica a la agricultura y lo que más le gusta es poder ver como crecen sus cultivos, los que después vende en el mercado de su ciudad a un buen precio. Como mujer trabajadora administra muy bien su dinero y cada vez tiene mayor capital lo usa para sembrar mayor cantidad de arvejas, ya que es el producto que más ganancias le genera. Pero sabe que necesita invertir en mayor cantidad de hectáreas de cultivo por eso en estos meses sembrará una parcela más de papa, confía en el apoyo financiero de su banco comunal. Además está pensando ahorrar dinero suficiente para poder comprar más terrenos agrícolas y así obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor.

Éste sería su crédito número 7 con MFP. Se siente cómoda dentro de su grupo “Unión Huanchán”, porque en todo este tiempo aprendieron a trabajar en equipo y también le son muy útiles las charlas que recibe.
Felicia invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10 bolsas de fertilizantes que requiere para su próxima siembra de arvejas.
texts.en:
52-year old Felicia lives with Eduardo with whom she has had eight children, but only three of them (aged 19, 17, and 14) are still alive. Her house is her own and is located in the district of Huasahuasi, Tarma. 

Despite her age Felicia works her fields with great care. The majority of her days she spends working the land where she grows potatoes, peas, beans, maize etc. She’s been doing this work for over 30 years. She most enjoys being able to see the crops growing which she then sells in the town market for a good price. 

Like any hardworking woman, Felicia looks after her money well, and whenever she has saved some extra cash she plants more peas as that is the crop that generates the most profit.  However, she knows she needs to invest in more land and so she will plant another parcel with potatoes. She trusts in the financial support that comes from her community bank. As well she is thinking of saving enough money to buy more farming land so she can earn more money to provide her family with a better standard of living.

This will be Felicia’s seventh loan with MFP. She feels at home in her group Unión Huanchán as they have all learned to work as a team. She also likes the workshops. Felicia will use the loan money to buy ten bags of fertilizer which she needs for the next crop of peas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jesus Christ Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUS CHRIST est formé de dix sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à une même famille. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Sènan Victorine est celle qui est complètement derrière et dont la main est légèrement levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sènan Victorine est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Grégoire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Sènan Victorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle exerce depuis sept ans et qui lui permet d'assurer ses différents besoins. Parallèlement, Sènan Victorine vend des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Sènan Victorine achète ses produits dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but d’être de plus en plus compétitive et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sènan Victorine désire obtenir un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESUS CHRIST.
texts.en:
The JESUS CHRIST group is made up of 17 people who live in the same neighborhood and who belong to the same family.

Sènan Victorine, who is all the way in the back of the photograph with her hand slightly raised, is the group representative. This is the first time that the group is seeking the financial support of ALIDé, in order to expand their business. Sènan Victorine is 40 years old and married to a man named Grégoire. The couple has two children, both of whom have received schooling and live in their care. The couple lives with the children and covers the household expenses together.

Sènan Victorine did not attend school, but learned hairdressing instead. She has been a hairdresser for seven years now, and this business allows her to meet her various needs. Sènan Victorine also sells cosmetic products in her studio. She buys her products at a market in Benin.

Striving to be more and more competitive and better meet the demand of her customers, Sènan Victorine wants to obtain a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the JESUS CHRIST group.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is 38 years old, married, and has three children. He has been operating a medical clinic for the past 11 years and earns an average monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

Bernard is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stocks of drugs.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff.  He intends to buy a piece of land with the profit earned from the business. His future dream is to expand his medical clinic into a big referral hospital.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of drugs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped-in water. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal. She says that her main challenge is the high cost of transporting charcoal, and dreams of opening a shop in the future where she can sell her charcoal to her customers. She is requesting a loan for KSH 20,000 to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and fertilizers for the rice farm and pay for its maintenance

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara is 60 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City with her husband and three children. For the last 21 years, she has earned a living by raising livestock (primarily pigs). She earns about PHP 8,000 a month from her work. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and is requesting a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy feed for her pigs. She plans to use the income generated from this loan to improve and expand her business. She believes that continued success in her business will allow her to provide the best possible care for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Garang, Tangub City, Philippines, where she owns a farm where she grows bananas. She has been in this line of work for 10 years, and earns about PHP 4,000 from her work. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,100 to buy seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC in order to earn enough money to improve her house and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops for a banana farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is the father of two children who are both attending school. He operates a hardware business where he sells construction materials to the general public. He has been in this business for the past two years. David aspires to hire some employees in the future to assist him in his operations. 

He lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water, and he describes rent and food to be his greatest monthly expenses.

With the loan of Ksh 25,000, he intends to purchase some metal materials to sell.

loans.use: to purchase some metal materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre de 57 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive conjuntamente con su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Morropón del departamento de Piura; básicamente es una zona donde su actividad principal es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio; así mismo cuentan con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe; esta zona  cuenta con más de 15 mil habitantes.

 Su actividad principal de Samuel es la venta de frutas, tales como naranjas, limas, plátanos, entre otros; así mismo cuenta con  7 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, donde le ha permitido mantener a su clientela ya fidelizada, y  esto lo realiza  en el mercado de Morropón. Samuel también tiene una parcela instalada de plátano, donde le va permitir tener otros ingresos adicionales, su cónyuge también le apoya en esta actividad.

El monto del préstamo otorgado es de S/.2,500 nuevos soles y lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio, específicamente para la compra de frutas para poder surtir su negocio; y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel, 57, is married and lives with his wife and son in the district of Morropón in the department of Piura.  The main business activities in this area are agriculture, livestock farming and commerce and the basic utilities are electricity, water and a sewage system, with a population of 15,000.

Samuel's business is selling fruit, such as oranges, lemons, and bananas, among others.  He has been in this occupation for seven years which has allowed him to establish a loyal clientele in the Morropón Market.  Samuel also grows bananas, with his wife's help, which gives him additional income.

The loan being granted is for 2,500 PEN, which Samuel will invest in his business, buying fruit to add variety so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy varied fruit for his business.

loans.name: Jony Alberto

texts.es:
Jony es un hombre de 40 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente  con 3 hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos, en el  Distrito de Tambogrande del departamento de Piura, así mismo también cuentan con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe; todas las familias viven en estas condiciones.


La actividad principal que desarrolla Jony es la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero, los cuales le producen leche  y lo comercializa en el mercado local, además cuenta con 1,0 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón y mango en producción que cosecha semanalmente, su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral donde le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales.

El monto del crédito otorgado es de S/. 2,800 nuevos soles, y se  invertirá en la compra de  alimentos balanceado para su ganado lechero y compra de fertilizantes para su  cultivo de limón; de esta forma le va permitir mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jony, 40, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the district of Tambogrande in Piura Department.  They, like the rest of the families in this area, have the basic utilities of electricity, water and sewage system.

Jony's main business is raising dairy cattle to produce milk that he sells at the local market.  He also has a patch of land where he grows lemons and mangos which he harvests weekly.  His wife raises poultry to earn additional income.

The loan in the amount of 2,800 PEN will be used to buy balanced animal feed for the dairy cattle and fertilizers for the lemon crop.  This will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for his dairy cattle and fertilizer for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Ma. Febes

texts.en:
Ma. Febes is married and has four children. She is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. Ma. Febes has been cultivating bananas for three years and earns PHP 4,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,100 to purchase fertilizer. 

Ma. Febes has been a member of GDMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Angel Floresmilo

texts.es:
ANGEL FLORESMILO tiene 59 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

ANGEL FLORESMILO se dedica al cultivo de orito, naranja y cacao.Solicita el crédito para realizar la compra de  madera, eternit y además comprar de una bomba para fumigar.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la madera, eternit, además comprar la bomba que mejorar el rendimiento de la producción.
Las compras y las ventas  de los productos lo realizan con frecuencia en el Cantón Montalvo.
El sueño de el es mejorar su vivienda, e incrementar los cultivos de cacao.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es que a pesar de la edad seguir realizando sus actividades ya que estas requieren de realizar mucho esfuerzo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar junto a sus amigos y cuidar su casa.
texts.en:
Angel Floresmilo is 59, married, and has two children. He lives with his wife in the Montalvo canton, Los Rios province. He belongs to the Embarcadero Chico communal bank, whose members sow cocoa, oranges, bananas, yucca, and plantains, and raise animals.
Angel Floresmilo cultivates bananas, oranges, and cocoa.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood, Eternit-brand fibre cement, and a pump for fumigating; this loan will help him to improve his yield.
He buys and sells his products frequently in the Montalvo canton.
His dream is to improve his home and increase his cocoa crop.
Despite his age, he has to keep working; this is a challenge because these activities require a lot of physical exertion.
In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his friends and caring for his home.

loans.use: to buy wood, Eternit-brand fibre cement, and a pump for fumigating.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Lilia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, detergents, and beverages.

Lilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, detergents, and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
María Manuela tiene 29 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

María manuela se dedica a realizar varios servicios ella trabaja es empleada en domestica. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales cómo cerdos, pollos. 

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para criarlos y venderlos a un buen precio.

Las compras lo hará en Chillanes. El sueño es poder comprar una casa propia. No se le ha enfrentado ningún tipo de problemas. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear y ver televisión.
texts.en:
María Manuela is 29 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives with her parents in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

María Manuela performs many services in her job as a domestic employee.  She is requesting a loan to buy animals, such as pigs and chickens.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy animals to raise so that she can sell them at a good price.  Her purchases are conducted in Chillanes.  Her dream is to buy a house of her own.  She is not encountering any problems.  

In her free time, María Manuela enjoys going out for walks and watching television.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
María es una mujer que tiene 66 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María vive en  el caserío Nueva Esperanza, distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura, así mismo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a a través de una noria artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Mercedes es la crianza/venta de ovinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su posee 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola donde tiene instalado limón donde le permite tener otros ingresos, su cónyuge también  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de fertilizantes y realizar labores de limpieza en su cultivo, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 66 year old woman.  She lives in her own home with her partner and she has three children under her care.  She mentions that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the inhabitants are independent workers dedicated to trade and breeding small animals.  Some of them also work in agriculture.  Maria lives in the village of Esperanza, district of Tambogrande, department of Piura.  The village has electricity services and water is consumed by means of an artesian well.  All of the families here live under these conditions.

Maria is in the business of breeding and selling sheep and poultry.  The breeding of these animals takes place in corals outside of her home.  It is worth noting that Maria’s six years of experience in this business has allowed her to keep her already existing customers.  She sells her animals to wholesalers in the area.  In addition, she owns 1.0 hectares of farm land where she has planted lemon trees. This provides additional income and her husband helps her with this activity.  

Currently, Maria is proposing to expand the inventory in her animal breeding/selling business because it is a very profitable business in the area.  For these reasons, she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of S/ 1000 nuevos soles which will be designated for the purchase of fertilizers and to clean her crops. In time, this will allow her to continue improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and clean her crops.

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIVOGBE est formé de vingt personnes qui appartiennent à une même collectivité. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Bernadette est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Bernadette est âgée de 59 ans et est mariée à un certain Robert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une vingtaine d'année, Bernadette vend des produits divers (maïs, tissus) et des produits cosmétiques de façon secondaire ; Ce qui lui permet d'assurer ses différentes charges. Bernadette achète ses produits dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but d’être de plus en plus compétitive et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Bernadette désire obtenir pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement VIVOGBE. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Vivogbe group is composed of 20 persons who belong to the same community. The representative of this group, named Bernadette, is the one with her hand raised on the photo. This is the third time this group requests the financial support of ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity.

Bernadette is 59 years old and is married to Robert. The couple has three children, all attending school and under their care. The couple lives together with their children. They cover together the household expenses. 

Bernadette did not attend school.  For the last twenty years, she has been selling various items (corn, length of cloth) and cosmetic products as a secondary activity. This allows her to cover her various expenses. She buys her items at a market in Benin.

In order to be more competitive and to better meet the demand of her customers, Bernadette, along with the other members of the Vivogbe group, would like to obtain a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been fully paid back.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn, cosmetic products and length of cloth.

loans.name: Janeth María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Janeth, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de  hijos de 3 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero uno de ellos aun  vive con ella. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en el trascurso de todo este tiempo con los créditos ya que le han servido de mucho para aumentar su negocio.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, así como también productos de bazar y papelería,  ella  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio mucho mas en las noches cuando está desocupado, ella lleva más de 20  años con su negocio y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que cada crédito que recibe es para aumentar aun mas y mas su tienda ya que sus clientes cada vez le piden más variedad de productos y ella tiene que darles lo que le pidan para no perder su clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres, artículos de bazar y papelería.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante y tener la mejor tienda de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "3 de Mayo" meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa Canton, a canton which is called the "Sultana del Café" because of its extensive plantations of coffee known for its unequaled flavor, and famous for its gastronomy and warmth of its people.

This is where we met Mrs. Janeth, 49, who is a single mother of three children who are adults.  One of them still lives with her.  She has been a member of the communal bank since it began, and she is happy with it because of the assistance she has received until now in terms of loans that have helped increase her business.

She runs a general store out of her home and sells all kinds of essential products, as well as bazaar articles and stationery goods.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and sometimes even later.  Her son helps her at night when he has time.  She ha been in business for over 20 years and it is going well.  She says that every loan she receives is to expand her store, since customers are always requesting a variety of products and she wants to provide good service so as not lose them.

This loan will be used to stock her store, as she will buy groceries, bazaar articles and stationery goods.

Her goal is to get ahead and have the best store in the city.

loans.use: To buy groceries, bazaar articles and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Luz, tiene 81 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, de esa relación tuvo diez hijos, pero uno de ellos falleció, los 9 restantes ya son mayores de edad e independientes.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse su propio sustento sin tener que depender de sus hijos se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  aves de corral, ella tiene una pequeña granja en su casa,  mete hasta 100 pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a  comerciante que llegan hasta su casa, de la misma forma hace con los chanchos, nos cuenta que uno de sus nietos le ayuda en su labor.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Es fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos se gana sus propios recursos y sale adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Damas Del Futuro [Women of the Future] meets every two weeks in Canton Pajan, a provincial canton known for animal husbandry and hosting the Montubio rodeo several times a year. Here we meet 81-year-old Luz, a widow whose husband died several years ago. She has 10 children from her marriage; one child died, but the remaining 9 are independent adults.

Our friend supports herself by raising pigs and chickens so that she does not have to be dependent on her children. Her house has a small farm where she raises 100 chickens for two to three months, the time needed to get them ready for market. Then she sells them and market-ready pigs to a merchant who comes to the house. She says that one of her grandchildren helps her with her work.

She will use this loan to buy chickens and food and medicines for both the chickens and hogs. She is the founder of the communal bank, which she likes because the loans provide her with resources and the means to get ahead. Her dream is to remain in good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food and medicines for chickens and hogs.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is a widowed woman with seven children between the ages of 17 and 37. She has been operating a food stall for the last 15 years, which is located at the market. Her other source of income includes earnings from her children. Tabu's primary customers are passersby and the local residents. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business. With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she will be able to purchase chairs and renovate her stall.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and renovate her stall.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, single, and has three children. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past 20 years earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Mary is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase green vegetables and fruits for her business.  She was introduced to KADET by an existing customer.  With the anticipated profit from the business Mary will educate her children. Her dream is to buy land and practice mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
For over two years in Molicay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Edna, a 47-year-old single mother of two children, has made a living through the buying and selling of coconut husks and branches. She earns 4,000 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Edna joined Kiva partner GDMP. She is now requesting a loan of 5,800 in order to obtain more coconut branches to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to obtain more coconut branches to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a mother of four, two of whom are in school. She operates a poultry business where she sells her products as retail. She has been in this business for the last three years, and she dreams of expanding this business and hiring employees in the future. Beatrice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Seasonality is her major challenge and that she spends more on school fees, food and rent over the month. She plans to use the loan of Ksh 30,000 in order to purchase some chicks.

loans.use: to purchase some chicks.

loans.name: Hilda Antonieta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hilda, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15,  12 y 6 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja para el Estado en calidad de contratado.

Nuestra amiga para poderse ganar algo por su cuenta y así poder contribuir con algo en los gastos del hogar se dedica preparar almuerzos para entregar, nos cuenta que son varios los lugares e instituciones públicas en los cuales de lunes a viernes entrega los almuerzos, ella trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos que son los encargados de distribuir los alimentos en estos lugares, mientras ella se encarga de cocinar y preparar los platos para las entregas, lleva ya 4 años realizando esta labor y le va muy bien ya que de a poco ha ido aumentando sus clientes los cuales están muy conformes ya que ella cocina delicioso y siempre les varia el menú.
  
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años,  es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Damas del Futuro" meets every 15 days in the Pajan Canton, which is known for its livestock farming.  One of the attractions is the Montubio Rodeo organized throughout the year.

This is where we met Mrs. Hilda, 39, who is married and has three children, ages 15, 12 and 6.  The two elder children are in junior high school and the youngest in grade school.  Her husband works for the State as a contractor.

In an effort to earn a little of her own income to help cover household expenses, our friend has a food business and delivers lunches to several public places and institutions Monday through Friday.  Her children who are the ones who distribute the lunches that she cooks and prepares.  She has been in business for four years and it is going very well after gradually increased her customer base because of her delicious, varied cooking.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries to prepare the meals.  She has been in the communal bank for eight years and is the acting secretary of the group.  She likes receiving assistance from the institution.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Berdali

texts.ru: Бердали женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозкультур. Имеет богатый опыт в данном бизнесе. Жена помогает по бизнесу. Бердали запрашивает займ для покупки 3 голов крупного и 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота. На остальную сумму хочет купить минеральных удобрений для выращивания зерновых культур. Он хочет получить хорошую прибыль от своего бизнеса, чтобы улучшить своё домохозяйство. Бердали надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Berdali is married and raising two children. For over 10 years, he has been buying and selling livestock, as well as growing crops, with help from his wife. He has a wealth of experience in this business. 

Berdali is requesting a loan to buy 3 cows and 2 goats or sheep. Using the remaining money, he wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing grains. He would like to get a good profit from his business in order to improve his living conditions. Berdali is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Yemalin Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement du nom de Julienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Julienne est mariée à un certain Gildas. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont trois représentent leurs propres enfants. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Julienne vend des liqueurs et autres articles à son domicile depuis une dizaine d’années. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Julienne contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Julienne sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de  ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Yemalin group is composed of 12 persons who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is named Julienne; she has her hand raised on the photo. 

Julienne is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to Gildas. The couple has four children all under their care. Three of the children are their own. Julienne lives together with her husband and her children. Together the couple provides for the various household expenses.

For the last ten years, to meet the various household needs, Julienne has been selling liqueur and other items from home. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. She contributes to the various household expenses with the revenue generated by her activity. 

In order to meet her ever-increasing customer demand, Julienne, along with the other members of the Yemalin group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Acheter des liqueurs.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали житель района Дангара. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Махмадали занимается животноводством. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en: Mahmadali lives in the Dangara region. He is 44 years old, married, and has four children who go to high school. Mahmadali has been raising livestock for the past five years. He is taking this loan to purchase livestock, which he will later resell.

loans.use: to buy sheep, goats and calves

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 57 years-old. He lives in a small village of Khobi District, West Georgia with his family.  HIs familly includes his wife,Lili, a 30 year-old son and his mother (a pensioner). The family earns a living through an agricultural business. 

They have a dairy farm with four milk cows and seven calves. Revaz and Lili milk the cows twice a day and produce cheese every day. On average they produce 70 kg of cheese. The family also has 40 goats in the family farm. Revaz sells kids in the village. Along with the above mentioned, the family members grow maize on family owned two hectares of land. Revaz uses part of the harvested maize for feeding the cows. The rest of the maize and produced cheese is sold on the local open market by Lili. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris per month. 

Revaz has requested a loan in order to rent a tractor for tilling the land. He will also use part of the loan in order to purchase fuel for the tractor. After tilling the land he will sow maize. Revaz, Lili and their son will work hard during the entire spring and summer in order to get a good harvest and to sell it at a convenient price. The family will use the profit received to finance the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fuel.

loans.name: Kose

texts.en: Kose is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Kose sells yellow bananas at the market, on a retail and wholesale basis. She works six days a week and has been in this business for eight years. Kose has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of yellow bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow into wholesale business. Kose would also like to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Lucrecia Cristina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucrecia, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos  Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y accesorios. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique y seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Damas del Futuro" meets every 15 days in the Pajan Canton, which is known for its livestock farming.  One of its attractions is the Montubio Rodeo which is organized throughout the year.

This is where we met Mrs. Lucrecia, 40, who is married and has two adult children, although one still lives at home.  Her husband is a farmer.

Our friend is a homemaker who, in an effort to earn her own income to help her husband with household expenses, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works three days a week, two to three hours a day, and delivers the products on a credit basis, collecting payment every eight days.  She has been in business for five years and it is going very well. Perfumes and cosmetics are her best selling items, she says, because they are very good.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and accessories.  She has been in the communal bank for two years, and likes it because the loan payments are easy to make.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Ruperta Marina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ruperta, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 15 y 10 años de edad, los menores  estudian en colegio y escuela, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se panificador. 

Ella junto a su familia se dedican al negocio de la panadería, nos cuenta que allí todos los días fabrican todo tipo de pan y pasteles, los mismos que son indispensables en la mesa de los ciudadanos en los desayunos, ellos desde la noche anterior dejan preparada la masa y desde las 4h30 se levantan a hornear el pan para que esté listo para cuando sus clientes lleguen a comprar, llevan más de 21 años en esta actividad y les ha ido muy bien, ya que con el tiempo que tienen su negocio son muy reconocidos y sus clientes gustan mucho de los que ellos ofrecen.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, levadura, azúcar y otros ingredientes para preparar el pan. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en el banco.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
The community bank called "Damas Del Futuro" gets together every fifteen days in the canton of Pajan, a canton known for its cattle.  The rodeo is the main attraction of the region and is held here throughout the year.

This is where we met Ruperta.  She is 40 years old, she is married, and she has three children that are 21, 15, and 10 years old.  The children study in college and school, and all of them live with her.  Her husband is a baker.

Ruperta and her family have a bakery where every day they bake all kinds of bread and pastries, which are essential to the breakfast tables of their customers.  Every night Ruperta and her family prepare for the following day.  They get up at 4:30 AM to bake the bread so that it is ready when their customers arrive.  They have been in this business for more than 21 years and it has gone very well.  They are a known business in the community and their customers enjoy what they offer.

This loan is to buy flour, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients to prepare bread.  Ruperta has belonged to the community bank for more than 10 years and she likes how the bank operates.

Her dream is that her children become professionals one day.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 30 years-old single mother from Kisumu City.  She has three children aged eight to 13 years of age.

Josephine operates a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables. This is a business she has been doing for the last ten years and she makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

She is taking her first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of fruits and green vegetables. Her profits will be used to grow the business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and green vegetables.

loans.name: María Pastora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, 6 de  ellos ya son mayores de edad y los menores tienen 17 y 16 años y son los que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga  es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar desde hace 15 años instalo un pequeño puesto en el mercado de esta ciudad, lugar en el cual todas las tardes se dedica a la venta de cueritos, carne y menudencia de pollo asada, acompañados de plátano asado y ensalada, allí también ella vende jugos, aguas y gaseosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 20h00, su esposo le ayuda en las noches cuando está desocupado, nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que dia a dia se sirven sus platos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar carne, cuero de chanco,  plátano, sodas, entre otras cosas. Es fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Damas Del Futuro [Women of the Future] meets every two weeks in Canton Pajan, a provincial canton known for animal husbandry and hosting the Montubio rodeo several times a year. Here we meet 61-year-old María, who is married and has 8 children. Six of the children are adults; her 16- and 17-year-old children still live with her and attend high school. Her husband is a farmer.

Our friend is a great homemaker. Fifteen years ago, she opened a small stall in the city market to help her husband meet the household expenses. Every afternoon she sells fried pig skins, meat, and grilled chicken giblets served with grilled plantains and salad. She also sells juices, water, and sodas. She works every day from 2 pm until 10 pm. When her husband is free, he helps her at night. She says that she serves her dishes to many customers each day. 

She will use this loan to buy meat, fried pig skins, plantains, and sodas, among other items. She is a founder of this communal bank, and she is happy that it provides her with loans. Her dream is to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, fried pig skin, plantains, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Najma Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Najma bibi is a 37-year-old married woman and by this relationship has three sons. All of them are young. Her elder son operates a grocery store, the next oldest has a shoe-making business. The youngest is free and doesn’t work. 

Najma herself owns and operates a clothes sales business. She sells clothes to different clothing shops and to her community and earns income for the family. Besides her business, she also gives proper time to her house and family. She manages the household work and takes care of her family. By seeing this devotion and loving behavior, her family respects and loves her a lot. 

Najma has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes sales business. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk for selling. She is very hopeful that the variety of clothes and larger quantity will enable her to increase sales and make her profits double in size.

loans.use: to buy clothes for clothes sales business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
From Molicay, Ozamiz City, Anita is 55 years old, widowed, and the mother of six children. For the last two years, Anita has owned and operated an agricultural business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale, earning PHP 4,000 a month.

Anita joined GDMPC In 2011 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,800 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, a 31-year-old married mother of six children, lives in Banglay,Tangub City where she has been selling bananas to earn a living for the past year. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000.00.

A member of PMPC for almost two years, Alma is requesting a loan for 7,000 to buy more bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to use the additional profits to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bananas to retail.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Virginia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for fiveyears. 

She is asking for a loan of 21,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

Virginia has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Paula Lupe

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año.
