En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paula, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  9, 4 y el menor de 4 meses de edad,  los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa de transportes.

Nuestra amiga tiene un taller en el cual se dedica a la fabricación de mochilas y bolsos, nos cuenta que esta profesión lo aprendió de sus hermanos que también se dedican a este mismo negocio, ella tiene tres maquinas en las cuales con dos ayudantes se encargan de elaborar estos productos los mismos que fabrica bajo pedido de varios comerciantes quien los llevan a vender a otros lugares, en la actualidad con el inicio a clases se han  visto muy ocupados pues ha tenido que fabricar muchas mochilas para cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le habían hecho con anterioridad. Lleva 6 años con este negocio que le ha dejado muy buenos ingresos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, reatas, varios materiales que se utilizan para fabricar las mochilas. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y confiables.
 
Su sueño es poder llevar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The community bank called "Damas Del Futuro" gets together every fifteen days in the canton of Pajan, a canton known for its cattle.  The rodeo is the main attraction of the region and is held often throughout the year.

This is where we met Paula.  She is 36 years old, she is married, and she has three children who are 9, 4, and less than 4 months old.  The older children attend school and her husband works in a transportation co-op.

Our friend has a workshop where she makes backpacks and bags. She learned this profession from her brothers who also work in the same business.  Paula has three machines, and with two assistants, they are responsible for making made-to-order products for retailers that sell them in other locations.  Now that school has started, they are very busy and have had to make a lot of backpacks to fulfill their customer's orders.  She has worked for 6 years in this business and has made a good income.

This loan is to buy yarn, material, thread, and other materials that she will use to make backpacks.  She has been through 3 loan cycles with the community bank and likes working with them because they are her close partners and are reliable.

Her dream is to be able to bring her products to other cities.

loans.use: to buy yarn, fabric, thread, and other materials to make backpacks.

loans.name: Catalina Gertrudis

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar vive la señora Catalina, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos ya mayores de edad, su ultima hija tiene 18 años de edad y es la que aun vive en su casa a pesar de que ya está comprometida. El marido es chofer.
 
Nuestra amiga para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de viernes a domingo y en estos días prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, nos cuenta que solo trabaja estos días porque es cuando más personas llegan a su local, en los otros días solo prepara almuerzos para entregar. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por  7 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres años y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un restaurante en el centro  de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The community bank called "Damas Del Futuro" gets together every fifteen days in the canton of Pajan, a canton known for its cattle.  The rodeo is the main attraction of the region and is held often throughout the year.

This is where Catalina lives.  She is 45 years old, she is married by common law, and she has three adult children.  Her youngest daughter is 18 years old and lives at home (although she is engaged to be married.)  Catalina's husband is a chauffeur.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses (the wages he earns are not enough to cover their needs), our friend began a business some years ago.  She has a small eatery in her house where she prepares and serves delicious dishes.  She works from Friday until Sunday and on these days she prepares breakfast, lunch, and snacks.  She only works these days because they are the only days people go out to eat.  The other days she only prepares lunches for delivery.  She has had her eatery for seven years and it has gone very well.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, and other foods for the preparation of her dishes.  Catalina has been a part of the community bank for three years and she likes the benefits it provides the community.

Her dream is to have a restaurant in the city center.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other foods.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, tres mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años  los mismos que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es chofer.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente dice que le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace mas de tres años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permiten ganar algo por su cuenta.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The communal bank Damas Del Futuro meets every 15 days in the region of Pajan, which is known for its abundant cattle.  One attraction there is the rodeo, which takes place at special times of the year.
   
Maria lives in this area.  She is 51 years old and has five children with her common-law husband, three of whom are adults, the other two of whom are 14 and 16 years of age and are in high school.  All of her children live at home with her.  Her husband is a chauffeur.

In order to make her own income, our friend sells products from Avon catalogues (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories.)  She sells door-to-door, working every day in the mornings since these hours make it easier for her to complete her rounds.  She extends credit to her customers and collects weekly, saying that she loves to sell and that she has been doing this for more than three years, during which things have gone very well since she has plenty of customers. Her biggest-selling items are cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, cosmetics, creams, and jewelry. She has been with the communal bank for four years, and she appreciates it because with one of the loans she was able to start her business, which allows her to earn her own income.

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and have good professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, creams, and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es:
Henrry es un hombre de   27 años de edad, de  estado civil casado, con un hijo a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo, en la Provincia de Lambayeque; la actividad económica de esta zona es la agricultura, el comercio y la crianza de animales, además cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe. 


La actividad principal a la que se dedica Henrry es brindar el servicio de  enllante y desenllante  de vehículos mayores y menores (carros, moto taxis, molineal, otros), este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su propio domicilio, lo cual cuenta con clientela ya establecida y cuenta con la experiencia requerida, su cónyuge además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores lo que le permite tener otros ingresos.


El  monto del préstamo solicitado por Henrry es de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, la cual estará destinada  para la  compra de una  máquina comprensora, actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su  local  donde brinda  este servicio de enllante y desenllante, y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Henrry is a 27-year-old man who is married and has one child in his care. He lives with his wife and son in the province of Lambayeque. The main economic activity in this zone is agriculture, trade and raising animals. It also has the basic services of electricity, water and sewer connections. 

The chief activity to which Henrry dedicates himself is providing tire mounting and tire removal services for heavy and light vehicles (cars, moto-taxis, motorbikes, and others). He has set up this business in his own home, and he has an established customer base and the required experience. His wife also works raising small animals, which provides additional income. 

The amount of the loan requested by Henrry is 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will be used to buy a compressor machine. He is currently planning to expand his shop where he provides this tire mounting and removal service, and thus improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a compressor machine for his business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva  is single and takes care of three of her brother’s children.  She has a poultry farming business, which she has been doing for six years.  She sells to all categories of people on a retail and wholesale basis.  Besides the poultry farming business, Eve earns additional income  selling charcoal.  She works seven days from her home.  

Eve is requesting a loan for 100,0000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy chicks and bags of chicken feeds.  Her monthly challenges include seasonality and chicken diseases. Eva would like to expand her business so that she owns 2,000 chickens.  

Eve resides in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her brothers’ children and feeding the family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and bags of chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, beans, rice, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Union Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sulma ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas y blusas para mujeres y varones, la socia también es docente den nivel primario, por medios de este negocio y trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar blusas, chompas y pantalones al por mayor. 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de peluches, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de leña y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD” ["Unity and Prosperity"] communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The borrower is Sulma, who is single. She is 48 years old and has 2 children. She works in her business selling clothing. She sells pants, sweaters and blouses for women and men. She is also a primary school teacher. Through her work and her business, the borrower is helping her children get ahead. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the clothing. She is requesting the loan to buy blouses, sweaters and pants on a wholesale basis. 

The other members work in businesses selling toy stuffed animals, selling handicrafts, selling firewood, and operating a grocery store. 

The borrower is grateful to all those who are contributing to her dream in this way, and she is committed to making her loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy blouses, sweaters and pants on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, is his family's main income provider and always searching for new ways to meet their needs. A blacksmith now for eight years, Kassem is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase metal for his business. He notes that this loan will help increase his productivity, and in the future plans to take more Kiva loans to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to purchase metal for his business.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang is a 50-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children, two of whom are already married and live separately around Prey Chor district. Yang owns and manages a rice farming business. She has been doing this for 22 years. She told us that she enjoys doing this type of business because it provides the main source of income for the family. Aside from farming, Yang operates a hog raising business for extra income. She has built a small wooden pigpen where she can place a few pigs.

To further improve her business, Yang has applied for a loan from HKL, a long-standing Kiva partner, to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She believes that she will be able to make her business become viable and profitable through using her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Las Topacios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Topacios” esta conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; artesania,  feriantes, ventas de alimentos, trabajo manuales, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Andrea, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie ocupando el primer lugar de la fila de izquierda a derecha, viste un chaqueta de color azul, su cabello lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de artesania especificamente tejidos y servicios varios preparando mermeladas de frutas de la temporada, se ocupa de estos negocios desde hace 14 años.
La mercaderia e ingredientes que va necesitando los compra en las ciudades de Valdivia y Santiago.
Con el credito arreglara su local en donde trabaja para ofrecer sus productos.
Las metas en su negocio son seguir creciendo para poder tener mas locales.
Andrea vive con su marido y su pequeña hija y uno de sueños es ampliar sus locales.
Ella esta agradecida de la oportunidad que le brinda Fondo Esperanza para crecer con su negocio. Ademas se encuentra comoda con el grupo, ya que existe respeto y confianza.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Las Topacios" and consists of 17 entrepreneurs who engage in different trades. These include making handicrafts, exhibiting products at the fairs, selling food, performing manual jobs, providing services, and other business activities. All of the members are from the city of Valdivia.

Andrea, the president of the Communal Bank, is seen in the photo standing in the first position from left to right. She is wearing a blue-colored jacket and has her hair taken back. Andrea is in the craft trade, specifically selling woven products and providing various services, such as preparing marmalades of various seasonal fruits. She has been in these businesses for 14 years. The merchandise and ingredients that she needs are purchased in the cities of Valdivia and Santiago. With this loan, she plans to remodel the shop in which she works so that she can offer her products. Her goals for her business include continuing to grow so that she can open more shops.

Andrea lives with her husband and young daughter. One of her dreams is to expand with more shops. She is grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her to grow her business. In addition, she is comfortable with her group, whose members demonstrate respect and trust.

Valdivia is a city in southern Chile and is located in the region of Los Ríos. This area is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle. Valdivia's main industries include ship builders, lumber mills, paper processing plants, cellulose plants (Celco), breweries, and grain mills. Tourism also plays a vital role, as well as educational institutions led by the Southern University of Chile.

loans.use: to remodel the shop where she offers her products.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, from Kisumu City, is 30 years old, married to Joseph, and the mother of a 12-year-old. For the last three years, Emma has been operating a charcoal-selling business, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

Now requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy more charcoal to sell, she will use her profits to grow the business. Emma's dream is to expand her enterprise and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Mrs. Edna is married with two children. Mrs. Edna is 42 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City.

Mrs. Edna sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 20,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional groceries for her sari-sari store.

Mrs. Edna has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Mrs. Edna hopes to use her profits to improve her living conditions by rolling her profits with her capital. Her purpose is to progress the status of her life.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a mother of three children between the ages of three and fourteen years. She is married to Masha who is a teacher. For the past five years, she has been selling both new and second-hand clothes at the market, mostly to passersby and neighbors. Her other source of income includes earnings from her spouse. Market competition is her major challenge. Marcelina owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and she dreams of opening a boutique in future. She intends to use the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 42-year-old business lady. She is married to James and their marriage is blessed with four children. Mary sells timber and earns an average monthly income of KES 12,000. She has been in the business for the past five years. 

Mary is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. Mary will use the loan to add more stock of timber and use the proceeds to educate her children and buy another piece of land. 


Her future dream is to become a timber merchant.

loans.use: to add more stock of timber for sale.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de maíz, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, él tiene ya 15 años en el negocio de crianza de ganado y siembra de maíz, de este oficio ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Actualmente está iniciando la siembra de maíz, para lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicidas, y tambien para el mantenimiento de la ganadería, este préstamo le ayudara con los recursos para la aplicación de insumos y mejorar la próxima cosecha.
La aspiración de Saúl es tener un mayor número de ganado, además de iniciar la siembra de hortalizas, con ello estará alcanzando un mejor desarrollo en su actividad.
texts.en:
Saúl works raising livestock and growing corn. He lives in his own house with his wife and his children. He has worked in this business raising livestock and growing corn for 15 years already, and with this profession he has succeeded in supporting his family. 

Currently, he is starting the corn planting, and for this reason he is requesting a loan to invest in buying fertilizer and herbicides, and also for the maintenance of his livestock. This loan will help him with the resources to apply these products and thus to improve the next harvest. 

Saúl's aspiration is to have a larger number of livestock, as well as to start planting vegetables. With this he will be able to achieve a greater level of development in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, detergents, and beverages.

loans.name: Edwin Reyes

texts.es:
Edwin, administra una tienda, vive en su propia casa con su esposa y dos hijos, hace un tiempo llego de estar en los Estados Unidos, instalo una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio lo inicio para tener una fuente de ingreso para su familia desde hace más de un año. 
El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería para la tienda, comprándose diversos productos que son necesarios para atender la demanda como granos básicos, harina, pastas, condimentos, galletas, dulces, pan, y muchos otros que son necesarios para su clientela. 
La aspiración de Edwin es crecer con el negocio, hasta lograr un mini súper, bien surtido y con mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Edwin owns and operates a store, and he lives in his own house with his wife and two children. A while ago, he spent some time in the United States, where he also opened up a general store so that he could make money to support his family. 

He is requesting this loan in order to invest in more merchandise for his store. He plans to buy a wide variety of necessary products to meet the demand of his customers, including: flour, pasta, condiments, crackers, cookies, sweets, bread and many other products. 

Edwin’s dream is to one day grow his small business into a mini supermarket that is well stocked and serves a large customer base.

loans.use: to purchase flour, pasta, condiments, crackers, cookies, sweets and bread.

loans.name: Jose Tulio

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad, él se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera, administrando su propio negocio de carpintería, tiene ya 7 años en el, lo tiene en su propia casa, lo atiende de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas para el negocio sea una sierra y un torno para decorar la madera,  esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la elaboración de los muebles, presentando un mejor trabajo con mayor calidad a sus clientes.
Él aspira fortalecer más el taller, mediante esta ayuda, para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children (who are 4 and 5 years old).  He is a carpenter and makes wood furniture.  He has managed his own carpentry business for seven years out of his home and he works Monday to Saturday.

He is now seeking a loan to buy tools for his business, such as a wood saw and a lathe for use in his woodworking.  This purchase will help him improve the design of his furniture so that he can provide higher quality products to his customers.

Jose aspires to expand his workshop, through this assistance, in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a wood saw and a lathe.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with 5 children. Myrna is 47 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City.
Myrna sells grocery goods to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 18,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional grocery goods for the retail store.
Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Myrna hopes to use the profits to improve living conditions by combining the profits with the capital. The purpose is to advance her family's status.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for the sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 45 years old. She is married with 5 children. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lolita raises coconuts to make a living. She checks the crops and makes sure of their progress. She has handled the business for 8 years. Every month, her earnings are PHP 15,000. In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 17,400 to purchase seeds/seedlings and young plants and to pay for land preparation. Lolita plans to widen her cultivated area to gain more income for the family and to plant more crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds/seedlings and young plants and to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, es casado y tiene dos hijos pequeños con los cuales vive en una casa en anticretico ocupando solo una habitación de adobe en la zona Santa Rosa Chica la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Edgar, trabaja como conductor de un vehículo de transporte de pasajeros por más de diez horas y el crédito lo necesita para la compra de llantas para su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia ya que no cuenta con seguro de vida y su trabajo es peligroso ya que corre el riesgo de ser asaltado por que trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche.
El sueño que tiene Edgar   es conseguir un anticrítico (una forma legal de alquilar una habitación o un par de habitaciones o un departamento por un tiempo determinado, por un monto total acordado, el cual será devuelto al fin del tiempo acordado) o tener casa propia para dar más comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Edgar is married and has two young children with whom he lives.  He lives in a house through an “anticrético” lease agreement. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.)  They live in only one adobe room in the Santa Rosa Chica zone in the city of La Paz.

Edgar works for over ten hours as a driver of a vehicle used for passenger transportation.  He needs the loan to buy tires for his vehicle.  This is the only source of employment that he has to support his family.  He does not have life insurance, and his work is dangerous.  He runs the risk of being assaulted because he works until the late hours of the night. 

Edgar’s dream is to get an “anticrético” (a legal way of renting a room or a pair of rooms or an apartment for a determined amount of time for an agreed upon amount of money.  The money will be returned at the end of the agreement.) or to have his own house in order to make his family more comfortable and safer.

This is the second time that he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle that he uses for passenger transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings, one of whom is working. He has owned an aluminum shop since 2007 and cooperates with his father to cover the heavy life expenses. Due to his significant skills, he was able, in a short amount of time, to build a great professional career. Today, he’s looking to take out a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new aluminum equipment in order to improve his business operations. In the future, he plans to open other branches in the surrounding areas.

loans.use: To purchase new aluminum equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Eupemia

texts.en: Eupemia is married and has one child. Eupemia is 54 years old and resides at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Eupemia owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 3,900 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Eupemia joined GDMPC. Eupemia wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is widowed with five children, and she takes care of additional family members (mother). Four of her children are in school.

She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 17 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings  from MCDT SACCO  which she  wants to use to buy more bananas, rice, beef, chicken, and sweet and Irish potatoes. She operates her business on retail basis and generates additional income through rental rooms. Milly works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.

Milly's goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to educate her children up to university. Milly resides in a house that she owns, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, rice, beef, chicken, and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a mother of one child who is 8 years old and is enrolled in school. She is married to Antony, an assistant chief. Saumu owns a kiosk where she sells her goods to her neighbors. She describes market competition to be her major challenge, and she aspires to open a wholesale in the future. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Saumu joined Yehu to get access to loans, and she describes food and school fees to be her greatest monthly expenses.
The loan will enable her to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to her kiosk.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to her kiosk.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su familia, él es vendedor ambulante de especias, tiene dos años dedicado al negocio el cual surgió por iniciativa propia, para mantener a su familia,  ya cuenta con experiencia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de los productos en especias como canela, anís, mostaza, comino, pimienta y achiote,  este préstamo le dará la oportunidad económica con la cual pueda incrementar su negocio, para tener mejores ventas.
La aspiración de Víctor es tener un mejor nivel de vida para su familia, proveyéndole a través del negocio todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Victor lives with his family and he is a street vendor that sells spices.  Two years ago he chose to begin this business (he had previous experience) in order to care for his family.

He is seeking a loan to buy more spices such as cinnamon, aniseed, mustard, cumin, pepper, and achiote.  This loan will provide him an economic opportunity with which he can grow his business and improve sales.

Victor aspires to improve his family's standard of living, by providing everything they need through his business.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, aniseed, mustard, cumin, pepper, and achiote.

loans.name: Olger Isabel

texts.es:
Olger es un hombre de 25 años de edad, de estado civil  soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa de su hermano en el distrito  de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; cuenta además con los servicios básicos como: luz, agua y desagüe, bajo estas condiciones viven todas las familias de este lugar. 

La actividad que desarrolla Olger es la crianza/venta de animales menores como: patos, pavos, gallinas, chivos, porcinos, y  también se dedica a la agricultura  donde tiene sembrado  limón y arroz, donde los conduce con una  tecnología media, permitiéndole tener otros ingresos adicionales. Se menciona que Olger tiene bastante experiencia en este tipo de negocio (comercialización de animales y la agricultura); así mismo él comercializa sus animales y sus productos a los comerciantes de la zona.

El monto del crédito solicitado por Olger es de S/.800 nuevos soles, el cual  será para  la compra de alimentos para engorde de sus animales  y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón y arroz, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olger is a 25-year-old single man without any children in his care.  He lives in his brother's house in the district of Tambogrande, department of Piura.  He has basic services such as electricity, water, and drainage.  All the families in this place live under these conditions.

Olger's work is raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, chickens, goats, and pigs.  He also works in farming growing lemons and rice, which he does with average technology, allowing him to have other income.  It was mentioned that Olger has a lot of experience in this type of business (selling animals and farming).  Also, he sells his animals and his products to the merchants in the region.

The amount requested by Olger is 800 nuevos soles (PEN), which will be to buy feed to fatten his animals and fertilizer for his lemon and rice crops.  This investment will allow him to continue growing in his business and so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, detergents, and beverages.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. Regardless of his young age, Mahmoud is doing the best he can to collect money and have his own family and children. For this reason, he decided to have his own business, so he opened a poultry shop in 2008. He’s a respectable person known for his good place and delicious food. Today, he’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of chicken, so that he can carry on his work properly and respond rapidly to his customer’s orders. In that way, his profits will increase by 50%. In the future, he plans to open a snack shop near his poultry shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of chicken.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en: Taleb is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. Because of heavy living expenses, Taleb was obliged to work hard in order to cover their needs and pay his children’s university fees. He has three children who are still studying and one other working. Taleb has many years of experience in the agriculture field. He decided to buy his own land in 2009 where he cultivates all kinds of fruits and vegetables. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s educational fees. This will certainly encourage them to finish their education and achieve higher positions in the near future. In the coming years, he plans to open his own fruits and vegetables shop to better support his children.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is married with five children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She is a tailor and works seven days a week. She has been in business for 10 years. Alex also earns additional income from selling milk. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cans of milk and a deep freezer. She has been in this business for five years. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Alex aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to educate her children to the university level. She would also like to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and transport.

loans.use: to buy more cans of milk and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and only one child. Her husband is the one covering his family expenses. As for Amina, she’s really smart and has her own style, which led her to have her own handcraft business. She has been working in this domain since 2008. In parallel, her husband also has worked as a wedding planner for 10 years. 

Amina is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase ribbons, pottery and other products for her work. She notes that this will increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase ribbons, pottery and other products for her work

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Luz  es separada   tiene 40 años  de edad y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “Esperanza y progreso” grupo  conformado por  7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Luz   se dedica al alquiler de cuartos desde hace un año, luz tenía un capital y lo invirtió construyendo su casa y  ahora alquila cuatro cuartos este negocio surge a raíz de su separación, gracias  a su esfuerzo y dedicación a, su hijo cuenta con educación privada, se ha comprado artefactos eléctricos y ahora cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida. Luz a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para ampliar y remodelar su negocio. Luz cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los prestamos de edaprospo la ayudaran
texts.en:
Luz is separated, 40 years old and has one school-age son. She is currently a member of the communal bank  "Esperanza y Progreso” [Hope and Progress], a group made up of 7 members who earn their living through a diverse range of businesses. Luz has been earning her living renting out rooms for one year. She had some money and invested it by building a house and now she rents out four rooms. Her business arose out of her separation. Thanks to her hard-work and dedication her son has had a private-school education, she has purchased electrical appliances and she now enjoys a better quality of life. 

Luz is asking for another loan to expand and remodel her business. Luz will attain her goals though a lot of effort and hard work and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to expand and remodel her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for pigs like hog starter, hog grower, and hog finisher.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam, es casada y tiene dos hijos, con los cuales vive en una habitación alquilada, la habitación es pequeña y con el piso de tierra ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como el maní y el azúcar ya que ella obtiene ingresos elaborando maní confitado y posteriormente vendiéndolo de forma ambulante por mas de doce horas y exponiéndose a muchos peligros por ejemplo robos y accidentes de transito ya que ambula hasta altas horas de la noche. También cuenta con los ingresos de su esposo ya que se dedica al transporte público es por eso que ambos aportan en los gastos de alquiler, alimentación y estudios de sus hijos pero su hija mayor ya termino el bachillerato y desea entrar a la universidad.
El sueño que tiene Miriam, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad  a su familia y tener una tienda donde pueda vender para ya no ambular por las calles.
Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto KIVA.
texts.en:
Miriam is married and has two children. They live in a rented house with small rooms and a dirt floor. Miriam resides in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. She needs this loan in order to buy supplies, such as peanuts and sugar, so that she can generate income from making candied peanuts. She spends more than 12 hours selling as a street vendor, which leaves her exposed to many dangers, such as robberies and traffic accidents, since she must walk around in the late hours of the evening. She also has access to the income of her husband, who works in public transportation. They both help one another with the expenses such as rent, food, and the education of their oldest daughter who wants to finish high school and enter the university.

Miriam dreams of having a house of her own so that she can provide greater comfort to her family and be able to open a shop so that she can stop traveling through the streets. This is the fifth time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar for making candied peanuts.

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es:
Rafael, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 11 años de edad, tiene casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura, de la cual ha logrado mantener a su familia, el aprendió con su padre, trabajando desde pequeño, ya tiene experiencia en realizar todo el proceso de la siembra.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de 1000 plantas de chile de Nataly, tambien el abono y foliares para el cuido y la productividad del chile, este préstamo le ayudara a Rafael, brindándole lo necesario para invertir en la siembra, con el único objetivo de tener una buena cosecha.
El objetivo de Rafael es contribuir con su trabajo al desarrollo económico de su familia, dándoles todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rafael lives with his wife and two children (they are 5 and 11 years old), owns his home, and works in agriculture.  Through his work he has been able to support his family.  He learned his work from his father and began working when he was small.  He now has the experience to work through the entire planting process.

He is seeking a loan to buy 1000 Nataly chili plants, and also compost and fertilizer for the care and production of the chili.  This loan will provide Rafael with the necessities for planting.  His goal is to have a good harvest.

Rafael's objective is to use his work to contribute to the economic development of his family and to provide for all their needs.

loans.use: to purchase 1000 Nataly chili plants, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 28-year-old married man. He is blessed with three children between the ages of one and five years. He owns a barber shop that has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of 4,000 KES.  

He is requesting his first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET LTD and wishes to purchase an electric shaver, towels and detergent for the business. 

The profits will be used for future investments. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase an electric shaver, towels and detergent.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with six children, all who go to school, and has two additional family members. She has a retail shop in the market. She works six days a week and has been in business for five years. Monica has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and boxes of soap. 

Her major challenges include the ever-increasing price of commodities and their transportation from Kampala to her shop.  She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to buy a van to make transportation easier. Monica would also like to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, rice, maize flour and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has been supplying cakes and bread to various retail businesses in Naivasha town for the past 11 years and it has been very profitable. He has a motorcycle that he uses to distribute commodities to the retailers. He is 36 years old, married to Daisy, and they have one child aged three years.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy a water tank for use in his home. In the future, Timothy hopes to expand his business and open a retail shop for his wife; hence making more income and improving the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Gaza. In 2008, Mervat opened an accessories and gift shop in her town. 

Mervat needs this youth loan to fill her shop with merchandise, buy a glass door, and add decorations. She aspires to be a successful manager in her business. 

By improving her business step-by-step, she hopes that the shop will become well-known in the area and bring a steady stream of income for her and her family.

loans.use: to fill her shop with merchandise, buy a glass door, and add decorations.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is the single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis, working seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and thieves.

Aida has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and cassava. She aspires to see her business grow so that she owns a big restaurant. Aida resides in a two-room house, where the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Parveen Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Kosar is a 38-year-old married woman and by this relationship she has three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son and a daughter read in 10th standard. The youngest reads in 5th standard.  Parveen wants to give her children a better education so they can spend their life in a better way. 

For this reason, she has a decorative embroidery business. Her work is home-based. She gets orders from her relatives and neighboring people and earns well after completing the orders.  

She is very talented by nature. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes, which helps attract more customers to her.  

Her husband is in construction and constructs buildings and houses. He gets work on contract and gets money when the contracts are over. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her decorative embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes, beads, and colored thread in larger quantity for preparing embroidered dresses. She will earn good profits. 

She started her business five years ago and is very confident that the loan investment will help her business to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothes, beads, and colored thread for her decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 46-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Esther who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. John has been in the farming business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after having been introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to own a pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Delia Victoria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Delia, tiene 57 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tuvo dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y el menor tiene 16 años, estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella.

Nuestra amiga tiene un taller en el cual de dedica de fabricación de cojines y almohadas, nos cuenta que ella les realiza distintos bordados para que sus clientes queden complacidos con los productos que ella ofrece, una vez al mes lleva a entregar sus productos a la ciudad de Guayaquil y entrega a ciertos bazares que luego los vende a los clientes, en esta ciudad ella regresa comprando los materiales que va a utilizar para la fabricación  de la  siguiente entrega. Ella también vende en su casa a clientes que saben y gustan de su trabajo. Tiene  4 años con este negocio y le va muy bien además le encanta lo que hace.

Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas y otros materiales necesarios  para fabricar los cojines. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
The Damas Del Futuro [“Ladies of the Future”] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Pajan Canton.  The canton is known for its thriving livestock industry.  One of its attractions is the Rodeo Montubio, which takes places at certain times of the year.

The canton is also the home of Delia.  She is 57 years old and is a widow; her husband passed away several years ago.  She has two children, one an adult and the other a teenager.  Delia’s younger child is 16 years old, attends high school, and still lives with her.

Delia has a workshop where she makes cushions and pillows.  She says that she decorates them with different embroidery for her customers, who are pleased with the products she offers.  Once a month she brings her products to the city of Guayaquil and delivers them to certain stores where she then sells them to customers.  While she is in Guayaquil she also purchases the materials she will use to make her next batch of cushions and pillows.  Delia also sells her products at her home to customers who know her and like her work.  She has had this business for 4 years and it is going well, and she loves what she does.  

Delia will use this loan to purchase thread, cloth, and other materials she needs for making cushions.  She has been a member of her communal bank from the very beginning and likes it because of the easy access to loans.

Delia’s dream is to carry on with her business and have excellent health.

loans.use: to purchase thread, cloth, and other material for making cushions.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is a 55-year-old mother of five children, all of whom are adults. She has been supplying coconuts to the various markets for the last 15 years. Mwaka lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. She describes high transport cost to be her major challenge. Another challenge is that she spends more on food over the month. She aims to expand the business and to supply her goods in more markets in various towns in the future. With the loan of KES 60,000, Mwaka will be able to purchase stock of coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase stock of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey, 28, is married to Margret and they have two children, aged eight and five years.

Geofrey sells electrical goods, such as power extension cables, bulbs, switches and other items, a business he has been doing for seven years. He makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD to add to his stock of electrical goods. He will use the profits to pay his children's school fees. Geofrey's dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to add to his stock of electrical goods.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a woman with four children who are all attending school. She has rented a house that has both electricity and piped water. Tabitha operates a grocery where she sells her goods at the market, mostly to the local residents and passersby. She spends most on food and school fees over the month. She dreams of hiring employees in the future. With the Ksh 30000, she will be able to purchase tomatoes, sukuma wiki, and bananas.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, sukuma wiki, and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa, 48, is a widowed Lebanese woman living with her three children, two of whom are working. Due to the high cost of living, they’re all joining forces to cover at least their necessities.

Najwa has been working preparing food for special events since 2008. She works from her home upon her customers’ demands.

Today, Najwa is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new kitchen tools and increase her food provisions. She really wishes for a better future for her children and she thinks that this Kiva loan will increase her profits, thus improving her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase new kitchen tools and increase her food provisions.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is the mother of four children, one of whom is in college. For the last ten years, she has owned rental houses and she says that some tenants are reluctant to pay their monthly rent, which poses a challenge to her.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings, Alima will be able to buy sand and cement to renovate one of her rental houses. She dreams of constructing more rental houses in the future. Alima owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. She joined Yehu to get loans. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to renovate one of her rental houses.

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Mariette, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona San Antonio de la ciudad de LA Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de ocho horas preparando la comida y luego vendiéndola en su pensión que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, también percibe ingresos por parte de su esposo que trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada repartiendo refrescos a las tiendas; de esta forma ambos cubren los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus hijos, aunque no cuentan con seguro médico.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra un refrigerador y refrescos para su pensión y de esta forma comprar más productos que pueden ser refrigerados y mejorar la atención a sus clientes para obtener mayores ingresos.
 El sueño de Mariette, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar sus ingresos como también su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mariette is married and has four children. She lives in the home of her parents in the District of San Antonio in the city of La Paz. Mariette currently generates income by working more than eight hours, preparing food that she will sell from the eatery that is set up in her home. She also has access to the income of her husband, who works for a private company that delivers soft drinks to the stores. Through their work, both of them are able to cover the food costs and their children's education. However, they do not have health insurance.

This loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and soft drinks for her eatery. By having more products that can be kept chilled, Mariette will be able to provide better service to her customers and generate more income. Her dream is to have a house of her own so that she can provide greater comfort for her family, as well as to improve her income and her quality of life. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and soft drinks.

loans.name: Karina Jeanneth

texts.es:
Karina, vive con su esposo y su padre, ella tienen tres hijos de 18, 14 y 10 años de edad, administra un comedor del cual ayuda en su hogar, desde hace dos años inicio con el negocio, lo tiene instalado en el mercado.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para el negocio, como aceite, condimentos, carnes, verduras y vegetales frescos, tambien utensilios para servir, este préstamo le ayudara a tener una mejor disposición para elaborar productos, aumentando la variedad de comida.
La aspiración de  Karina es tener mejores ventas y crecer en el negocio, porque así estará obteniendo mejores utilidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Karina lives with her husband and her father.  She has three children ages 18, 14 and 10.  She runs a dining room which helps support her home.  She began it two years ago, and she has it set up in a market.  

She is asking for a loan to purchase raw material for the business, like oil, condiments, meat, greens and fresh vegetables, as well as serving utensils.  This loan will help her to have a better situation for making products and increasing the variety of her foods.  Karina's aspiration is the have better sales and to grow the business, because in that way she will be obtaining better income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase oil, condiments, meat, greens and fresh vegetables

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old man.  He is married and a father with one son and two daughters.

For the past year, he has been selling used products such as home appliances and electrical goods.  He is moving from one place to another by a rickshaw he owns.  This has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing used products in bulk to resell. This will increase his sales and improve his family's income.

Mohammad is photographed next to the rickshaw he owns.

loans.use: To purchase used products in bulk to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 32, is married to Cornel and they have four children, aged one to 13 years.

Caroline has been selling fish for the last nine years, making a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy more fish stock. Her profits will be used to grow her business. Her dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Souraya

texts.en:
Souraya, 30, is a Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are still attending school. She strives to work really hard in order to offer them a better future, with the cooperation of her husband. After many years of experience in the trading field, she decided to start her own home business is 2009, selling all kind of clothes. She works independently and has gained a fair number of shops owners as clients looking to buy her products.

Today, Souraya is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more clothes and other items for her business. She notes that this will help her to develop her work and boost her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Faress

texts.en:
This borrower, who is from Iraq, is 40 years old, married and has four children. Faress has owned an electric generator since 2011, leasing electric lines to people in his surrounding area. Well-known and experienced, he enjoys a good reputation in the area. 

Faress is requesting a loan of  $2400 to repair the generator's engine.  He aims to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to repair his generator's engine.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has three children.

Kassem has owned a carpentry workshop since 2006. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for 1,500 USD loan in order to purchase a generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, es casado y tiene un hijo pequeño, con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.
René, estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas como carpintero realizando puertas y revestimientos en madera ya que no cuenta con otros ingresos para pagar los gastos médicos, alimenticios y de estudios para su hijo, ya que tampoco cuenta con seguro médico.
El trabajo que realiza no es muy peligroso pero si muy sacrificado ya que tiene que cargar con bloques grande de madera para la elaboración de las puertas.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de maderas, clavos, pegamento, pintura, etc., para la elaboración de otros trabajos para posteriormente ponerlos a la venta. Sus mayores ingresos provienen de trabajos que realiza a pedido.
El sueño de René, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia y también poder tener un taller más grande con esto mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
René is married and has a small son he lives with in his parents’ house occupying just one small bedroom; the house is located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Adela zone.

René only studied up to secondary school and is currently working more than ten hours per day as a carpenter making doors and wood paneling since he has no other source of income to pay for his son’s medical expenses, food and schooling because he does not have health insurance.

The work he does isn’t very dangerous but it is demanding because he has to carry large bundles of lumber to make the doors.

He needs the loan to buy lumber, nails, glue, paint, etc. to make other things to put up for sale later.  His largest payments come from jobs he does to order.

René’s dream is to have his own house to give his family more comfort and to have a larger workshop to improve his quality of life and his income.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, glue and paint.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio, es casado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en secundaria, viven en  casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones con pared de adobe y piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente obtiene ingresos ya que tiene un minibús y se dedica al transporte urbano trabajando por más de diez horas ya que el cubre los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus hijos. El trabajo que realiza Herminio es bastante peligroso por que trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Herminio es construir más habitaciones y mejorar las que tiene ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Herminio’s married and has two children attending secondary school.  He lives in his own house occupying just two rooms with adobe walls and a dirt floor; the house is located in the city of El Alto.

He earns income at present because he has a minibus and he works providing urban transport for more than ten hours since that’s how he covers his children’s food and education costs.  The work Herminio does is quite dangerous because he works until the wee hours of the night which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy tires for his vehicle because it’s the only source of income he has to support his family.

Herminio’s dream is to build more rooms and improve the ones he has because he’d like to have more comfort and to improve his quality of life.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tires for his minibus.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is married with 3 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lucita owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 9 years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 7,200 to purchase farm chemicals. Lucita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for 2 years. In the future, Lucita hopes to obtain another plot of farm land in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu  is married with 3 children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products ot retail. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of SHS 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business. She would also like to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 60-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and seven children. Five of them are still studying while the others are working. He’s trying the best he can to enhance his family’s way of life. He has owned a library for seventeen years. He has a good job and is happy about what he has attained so far.  Today, he’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional stationary and books for his library. Definitely, this will develop his business and help him earn more income. In the future, he plans to expand his business and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stationary and books for his library.

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en: Nayfeh is a 36-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and four siblings. Three of them are working. In addition to her father, she cooperates with her siblings to bring added income to the family. She owns an accessories, bags, perfumes, and gifts shop in her town where all the ladies can benefit from her products. Today, she has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional items to add to her existing stock such as accessories. She notes that this will return big profits for her. In the future, she plans to add clothes to her shop.

loans.use: to buy additional items to add to her existing stock such as accessories.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdalene is 54 years old, a business lady who is a widowed with two children, ages 22 and 15. She has been running a retail shop as a primary business and rental houses as a secondary business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to cater to her children’s basic needs. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Magdalene will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil.  

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy land for farming which will help her improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en: Zulaika is married with five children. All of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (relatives). She has a business of selling charcoal at the market on retail and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO which she wants use to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she generates additional income through a retail shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to go to the village of Luwero to buy bags of charcoal become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in the home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.

For the last two years, Lydia has been operating a retail poultry business, selling her products mostly to hotel owners in the neighborhood. She also owns some rental houses, which supplement her income. High transportation costs are a challenge for Lydia. She hopes to hire employees in the future. Lydia joined Yehu to get funds to expand her business. She plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to buy some chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy some chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children. One of his children works and the other is still a student. Fares supports his family with pleasure and he's ready to show help whenever they need it. For the past 4 years, he has been working on his own, as a van driver. His job consists of transporting his customers from town to town. Fares is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his van and to purchase the required paint for it. This loan will allow him to continue his job properly. In the future, Fares plans to borrow more loans from Kiva and to improve his business.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance and purchase required paint for his van

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
María, es una persona de hogar, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos y tambien trabaja realizando oficios de ama de casa, la venta de plátanos la inicio hace dos años, lo aprendió de su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un flete de plátanos verdes, para la venta, este préstamo le ayudara a María para proporcionarles los recursos económicos y realizar la compra, para mantener siempre surtido su negocio.
Ella quiere mejorar el negocio, con otros productos que a futuro ira incluyendo, tambien quiere obtener un local propio donde pueda estar más accesible para los clientes.
texts.en:
María is a homemaker who lives with her husband and her three sons.  She works selling plantains and also works doing household jobs.  The selling of plantains she began two years ago and she learned it from her family.  

She is asking for a loan for the purchase of a freight of green plantains to sell.  This loan will help her by giving her the economic means to realize her sales and to maintain her business with supplies.  

She wants to improve her business with other products that in the future she will include.  She also wants to obtain her own local business establishment where her products can be more accessible to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a truck-load of green plantains to sell.

loans.name: Sylviah

texts.en:
Sylviah, 43 years old, is from Kakamega. She is married to Francis and they have two children, aged 10 and 5. For the last 2 years, Sylviah has operated a fish selling business, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Sylviah is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of small fish for sale. Her profits will be used to raise her family's living standards. Sylviah's dream is to have a stable and comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of small fish for sale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a single mother of three children, all attending school. She takes care of additional family members (a sister). For the past few months, Aida has operated a beauty salon business from her home. She works seven days a week and on all categories of people. Aida generates additional income through selling charcoal.

Aida has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), which she plans to use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges are unreliable electricity and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Aida hopes to see her business grow big so that she can own a bridal salon and build her house. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because she wanted to generate more capital. Aida lives in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes  of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís es soltero y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente estudia Comunicación Social en la Universidad, y se dedica a la música ya que percibe ingresos por que trabaja como músico en una banda por más de diez horas. También fleta sus instrumentos los fines de semana, es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que necesita comprar los platillos para la banda donde trabaja y mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos alimenticios, servicios básicos y médicos de su madre, ya que es mayor de edad y no cuentan con seguro médico; Luis  también cubre los gastos de sus estudios de la universidad con los ingresos que percibe.
El sueño de Luís es tener una orquesta completa, para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
 El trabajo de Luís es muy peligroso por que trabaja por las noches y hasta altas horas de la madrugada ya que los contratos que recibe mayormente son para fiestas nocturnas.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luís is single and has no children.  He lives in his mother’s house occupying just one small room with a dirt floor; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.

He is currently studying Social Communication at the university and earns income working as a musician in a band for more than ten hours.  He also rents out his instruments on the weekend which is why he needs the loan because he needs to by cymbals for the band where he works and to improve his income to cover food, utilities and his mother’s medical expenses because she’s elderly and they don’t have medical insurance.  Luís also covers his university expenses with the income he earns.

Luís’ dream is to have a complete orchestra to improve his income and to help his family.  

Luís’ work is very dangerous because he works nights until the wee hours of the morning because the contracts he gets are mostly for nighttime parties.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cymbals for his band.

loans.name: Rudi Alberto

texts.es:
Rudi, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues tiene la oportunidad de aumentar el ganado, comprándose dos terneros, con este préstamo lograra tener los recursos económicos para realizar la compra que será una gran ayuda para él.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue muy positivo, pues ha seguido trabajando con la compra y venta de ganado, dándole una mayor oportunidad de capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rudi is asking for a new loan, since he has the chance to add to his cattle by buying two calves.  With this loan he will gain the economic means to accomplish the purchase, which will be of great help to him.

The previous loan that he received had a very positive effect, since he has continued working in the purchase and sale of cattle, which has given him a greater opportunity for earnings from his work.

loans.use: To purchase two calves.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, quiere seguir con las actividades agrícolas, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la siembra de maíz y frijol (abono y fertilizantes), pues se está preparando para una nueva siembra.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprarse lo necesario para el cultivo y le dio buenos resultados en la producción de la cosecha, dándole la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su trabajo a través de los créditos, con esto tambien se beneficia su familia.
texts.en:
José wants to continue with agricultural activities, and for that reason he is asking for a loan in order to purchase necessities for planting corn and beans (various fertilizers), since he is preparing for a new crop.

With the previous loan he was able to purchase the necessary items for his crops and he had good results in the production of the harvest, giving him the opportunity to continue improving his work through credits.  This credit will also assist his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus abuelos ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como procurador de tramites con dos abogados, el crédito lo requiere para la elaboración de su tesis de grado ya que actualmente estudia derecho en la Universidad, pero con lo que gana trabajando por más de diez horas no le alcanza para poder pagar sus estudios ya que también cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, y médicos de sus abuelos.
El sueño que tiene Reynaldo, es independizarse y tener su oficina para tener sus propios clientes y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que el cliente pide préstamo en IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is single and does not have children.  He lives in a just a small room in his grandparents’ house.  The house is in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income because he works as an assistant for two lawyers.  He needs the loan for the production of his postgraduate thesis.  

At the present time he is studying law at the university.  However, what he earns for working over ten hours is not enough to pay for his studies and also cover the expenses of food, basic services, and doctors for his grandparents.
