Edisa needs a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help them bring in more fish to sell. Edisa works hard to improve their income and sustain her family. It is her goal to have her children finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Ronelio

texts.en:
Ronelio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has three children aged nine, ten and twelve. Ronelio earns 6,000 PHP per month from fishing. His income goes on his family's daily consumption and children's education. He hopes to have additional income to improve his family's living situation. 

He requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Ronelio hopes to build up more savings for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Jerecson

texts.en:
Jerecson is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for almost seven years. Jerecson works hard to support his family of a wife and two children. 

He requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. Jerecson hopes to have a stable business that will allow him to provide a proper education for his children. It is his desire to see them have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Sheirel

texts.en:
Sheirel is thirty-one years old and is a married woman with three children aged two, seven and nine. She runs a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Her income goes on her family's daily consumption and her children's education. 

She needs a loan to purchase a boat engine. Sheirel hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her family. She also hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine.

loans.name: Grupo 1, 2 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 1 & 2” (Breezes 1 & 2 Group). The group is comprised of fifteen members with small businesses who sell different products. Francisca’s family is made up of her long-term partner and their three children. They live in a rented home, which is a simple structure built of wood. Her most difficult challenge has been always working to bring in extra income for her family and provide for her children's education. She enjoys to work.

Francisca’s business is a small butcher shop. She sells bacon, pork and salty beef. She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of this meat. She has been working in this business for about four and a half years. This is her 6th loan with Esperanza Internancional. She will use her business profits to help with the needs of her family and her house: she will be able to buy more and better food and save so that in the long-term they will be able to have their own house. 

This group is located in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo. It is to the north of the city.

loans.use: to buy several pounds of meat (pork and beef).

loans.name: Champions Plus Group

texts.en:
Régine, aged forty-nine, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Champions Plus”. It is composed of ten members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Régine has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005. She sells beverages. Her business is located to the north-east of Kinshasa. Régine has already received loans from MFI HOPE DRC five times and repaid them correctly. 

The loan she will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $15 per week. Regine’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in her area. She is a widow and the mother of six children whose ages range from nine to thirty-two. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying some crates of beverages to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is twenty-three years old and is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She is a seaweed farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Aside from seaweed farming, she also sells personal-use products and detergent soap. Cristina works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs and saving for their child's education. 

She requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings and more merchandise to sell. Cristina hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene 57 años y es soltero con 3 hijos ya independientes, el es agricultor tiene su parcela que se encuentra la localidad El Porvenir, el Sr. Martin es cliente antiguo de la institución, ya que  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Martin  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la falta de capital para la siembra de papa, el Sr. Martin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando la siembra la cosecha de sus productos, el vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Martin is 57 years old, he is single and has 3 children who are already grown up. He works as a farmer and has a plot of land which is located in the locality of El Porvenir. 

Martin is a long-standing customer of the micro finance institution, as this loan is his fifth loan cycle with them. Martin will use this loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes, as well as to cover the costs of preparing the land. 

The reason for requesting this loan is due to a lack of capital to plant potatoes. The challenge Martin faces in his business is to improve his quality of life, and he will use the profits to continue to improve the planting and harvesting of his products. He sells his goods in the local market, selling directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 63 años de dad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica al oficio de las confecciones, actividad que inició desde el año 1986, cuando trabajó en varios talleres donde adquirió una gran parte de su experiencia en el oficio. Desde el año 2002 decidió iniciar su propia aventura de negocios, confeccionando todo tipo de ropa entre familiares y vecinos, que fueron su   merado inicial, gradualmente fue dándose a conocer porque sus pocos clientes la recomendaban y así mismo su producción fue aumentando, hasta que construyó su clientela fija y aunque existe una alta competencia responde a su clientela con precios competitivos teniendo en cuenta las posibilidades de su mercado y su necesidad de generar ingresos. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa y en ello se encuentra ahorrando. Su mayor desafío es no contar con un capital de trabajo suficiente para tecnificar un poco y aumentar su productividad y ofrecer un acabado inigualable. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una fileteadora industrial,para reemplazar la fileteadora familiar con la que cuenta, con ella logrará su propósito y el éxito de esta inversión en lo concerniente al mejoramiento de su productividad y competitividad..
texts.en:
Ana is 63 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She dedicates herself to sewing, an activity she has carried out since 1986, when she worked at various workshops where she gained the majority of her experience.  In the year 2002, she decided to embark on her own business adventure, making all types of clothing for friends and neighbors who were her first market.  She gradually became known because her small clientele recommended her and her production grew until she built a stable customer base.  Although there is a great deal of competition, she responds to her customers with competitive prices, keeping in mind the potential of her market and the necessity to generate income.

Her future goal is to have her own house, for which she is saving.  Her biggest challenge is not having enough working capital to become a little more technical, augment her production and offer an unequaled finished product.  This is the reason why she turns to Kiva credit, and the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy an industrial sewing machine to replace the one she has now.  With this machine, she will reach her goal and the success of this investment as it concerns the improvement of her productivity and competitiveness.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Milagros Del Rosillo

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer de 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia con su hijo en el distrito de  Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; la actividad económica  en la zona es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio, cuentan también con los servicios básicos de agua, luz y desagüe. 

La actividad que desarrolla Milagros es la venta de cerveza, este negocio lo tiene  en su domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes y cuenta con tres años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, donde le permite tener otros ingresos.

El monto solicitado por Milagros es de S/. 800 nuevos soles, lo cual será para la compra de  cerveza, para atender a su clientela y además de realizar compra de sillas, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Milagros is a 22-year old single mother with 1 child in her care.  She lives with her son in her own house in the district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura district.  The economic activities in this area are agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.   They also have basic services such as water, electricity and drainage.

The activity that Milagros carries out is the sale of beer.  She has the business in her home, where she tends to her customers.  She has three years of experience in this type of business and, in addition, she sells beauty products to generate other income.

The amount requested by Milagros is 800 Peruvian soles.  She will use these funds to buy beer for her customers, and also chairs, to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy beer and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Ivette Maria

texts.es: Ivette Maria esta Sra. es casada en ocasiones anteriores ya se le ha brindado financiamiento lo cual ha demostrado ser horonda, cumplida  con sus pagos y con alta solvencia moral, en la actualidad  Ivett  está solicitando el crédito para la construcción de sus casa  ella con su propio esfuerzo ha comprado un terreno y necesita comprar el material para dicha construcción, el sueño de Ivett es tener un lugar propio donde vivir con su familia y este sueño solo lo ha podido cumplir poco a poco con la ayuda del financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado.
texts.en: Ivette Maria is married and, on the previous occasions where she has been provided with financing, has demonstrated herself to be honorable, responsible with her payments, and to have a high moral reliability.  Currently, Ivette is requesting this loan for the construction of her house.  She, through her own effort, has bought some land and needs to buy materials for said construction.  Ivette’s dream is to have her own place to live with her family, and she has only been able to make this dream a reality little by little with the financial assistance that Fundación León 2000 has provided for her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials:  cement, bricks, zinc, flooring, lime and sand, among other items.

loans.name: Wilmer Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano de derecha y sobre todo su mayor apoyo, juntos tiene un pequeño de 3 años de edad quien es su adoración y sobre todo su motor y motivo de vivir y salir adelante día a día sobre todo para que sea una persona de bien y sea mejor que él. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, hermosas playas, atractivos turísticos hermosos como las “Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura y la pesca y también se le conoce por la calidez de sus pobladores. Cuando Martin tiene un tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte sobre todo jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, también de vez en cuando aprovecha la oportunidad de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas.

Con mucho esfuerzo Martin trabaja en su negocio de venta de pescado, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias, el ofrece sus productos especialmente a los restaurantes de la zona, especialmente a los que preparan el riquísimo ceviche ya que este platillo es a base de pescado; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocido y sobre todo ofrece productos en buen estado.

Martin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado, el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (pescado al por mayor), ya que tiene varios pedidos, lo que le permitirá mejorar  sus ingresos y su calidad de vida , para así seguir luchando cada día y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprarse un terreno para construir su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Martin is a responsible and hard-working young man who lives alongside his wife, his right hand and greatest supporter.  Together, they have a 3-year old child who they adore, is their reason for living and getting ahead each and every day, and who they want to be a good person.  His home is located in the city of Pisco, which is characterized for having a warm climate, beautiful beaches, and wonderful tourist attractions such as the Ballestas Islands and the El Candelabro of Paracas geoglyph.  Likewise, the area is an agricultural and fishing zone, also known for friendly residents.  In his free time, Martin likes to play sports with his friends and neighbors, soccer in particular, and occasionally take the opportunity to eat one of his favorite foods, the delicious “Rice with Duck”.  He only finished secondary school, but would have liked to study Systems Engineering.

With great effort, Martin works his business selling fish.  He works around 8 hours per day, offering his products mainly to the area’s restaurants, especially those who prepare the delicious ceviche, a fish-based dish.  He thinks things are going well with his business because he is well known and, most of all, he offers a good product.

Martin is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy more merchandise (fish at wholesale) since he has several orders.  This will permit him to improve his income and standard of living, and to continue struggling each day to make his greatest dreams a reality:  “To buy land for building his own home and to provide a good education for his child”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fish at wholesale).

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 47-year-old, hardworking man who has four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a policeman by profession and has been in this service for 20 years. His dreams are to educate his children and build a permanent house. Stephen needs the loan to buy land on which to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy land on which to build a permanent house.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en: Cipriana is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married to a fisherman. Cipriana sells snack foods and home-cooked meals to her community. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income. She has applied for a loan to buy cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices. Cipriana hopes to be able to earn more money as well as start a sari-sari (convenience) store business.

loans.use: to buy cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.en:
Reinerio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is 41 years old, married and has four children. 

Reinerio's family relies on his fishing. He works extra hard to supply his family's needs and sustain his children's education. 

He applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and lead weights. Reinerio wants his family to be able to eat three times a day. He also hopes for his children to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and lead weights.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 40-year-old, married woman with six children between the ages of 3 and 19. Her husband is a utility worker.

Cristita sells various items in her store such as soft drinks, biscuits and toiletries. Her income is used to provide for her family's daily consumption. 

Cristita finds it difficult to replenish her merchandise rapidly. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and snack foods. 

Cristita's dream is for her family to have a more stable way of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and snack foods.

loans.name: Sezi

texts.en:
Sezi is a 55-year-old, married man with eight children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Sezi has been selling books for two years. His hardships include price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house and pay his taxes. 

His business goals are to diversify and move his business to a more permanent location as well as expand his business into new markets. 

Sezi has requested a loan to buy books to sell.

loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine children, eight of whom are school-age. 

Divina sells processed sea cucumbers and seashells. She has a regular buyer, which makes it easier for her to sell her products. Divina works hard to improve her business. She requested a loan to buy more sea cucumbers and seashells to sell. 

Divina's hopes for the future are for her business to grow and for her children to finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to buy more sea cucumbers and seashells to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 44 years old, married and has four children, ages 16, 19, 21 and 26. 

Laura and her husband run a fishing business. Laura sells her husband's catch at the market. She requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and gasoline for the boat. Laura hopes to expand their business and improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and gasoline.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in her town Nocnocan, Talibon. She sells items like snack foods, toiletries, sugar and coffee. Mary Jane wants to provide for her family's basic necessities. She does her best to be a good seller and retain regular customers.

Mary Jane would like to request a loan to buy more merchandise to sell and to renovate her store. She hopes that her store will attract more customers and have increased sales.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell and to renovate her store.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a 31-year-old married man with one child living Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been operating a boutique for three years and he got his initial capital from his salary savings since he is a teacher.

His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. 

His personal goals are educating children, building a permanent home and self education. 

His business goals are diversifying the business, moving the business to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets.

Amon wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sele

texts.en:
Sele is a 40-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in the restaurant and video hall business for four years. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goals are hiring employees to help expand the business and expanding the business into new markets.

Sele wants money to buy a projector and food and to renovate the video hall.

loans.use: to buy a projector, renovate the video hall and buy food.

loans.name: Damigou

texts.fr: Revendeur de pneus, ciment et vélo d’occasion depuis 2011, Damigou un jeune homme de 28ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il exerce son activité dans une boutique et a de nombreux clients. Pour bien répondre aux désirs des clients, il sollicite ce premier prêt de WAGES pour acheter de l’huile à moteur, des vélos et des tonnes de ciments. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité assurer sa prospérité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Damigou is a 28-year-old man who has sold tires, cement and second-hand bicycles since 2011. He is single and has no children. He works in a store and has numerous customers. 

To better meet the needs of his customers, Damigou has requested this first loan from WAGES to purchase engine oil, bicycles and several tons of cement. He plans to reinvest his profit in his activity to ensure that he prospers and to better look after himself.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bicycles, engine oil and cement.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man with four children. 

He has been in the fishing business for quite some time now. His income goes to the family's daily consumption. Virgilio works hard to improve his earnings and be able to elevate his family's standard of living. 

He applied for a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights and floaters. Virgilio hopes to achieve his goals soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights and floaters.

loans.name: Yemalin 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN 1 est composé de douze personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement du nom de Nadège est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nadège est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Nadège est mariée à un certain Henry. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Nadège n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Nadège vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différents besoins de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Nadège vend des sacs de maïs, des nattes et de l'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) dans un marché du Benin depuis cinq ans. Nadège s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ces activités, Nadège contribue aux différents besoins de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Nadège sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN 1.
texts.en:
The Yemalin 1 group has 12 members who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Nadège, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Nadège is 25 years of age and lives in Benin. She is married to Henry, and the couple has two children under their care, who are at school. Nadège herself did not go to school. She lives with her children and husband, and together the couple meets the different needs of the family.

To contribute to her family’s various needs, Nadège sells bags of corn, mats and akassa (a corn-based paste) in a market in Benin, and has done so for the past five years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. Thanks to the income generated by these activities, Nadège contributes to her family’s various requirements. To meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she has requested a loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Yemalin 1 group.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a rice farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She 43 years old, married and has an 18-year-old child. Evelyn works hard to help provide for her family. 

She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Evelyn hopes to earn better and be able to improve her family's living conditions. She also hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en:
Neverless is a 34-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been dealing in drinks and eggs for ten years. She started with 600,000 UGX from the savings she got from farming. 

Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather.

Her personal goals are educating her children, building a permanent house and self education. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, moving the business to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets.

Neverless wants money to buy beer and eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Everketh

texts.en:
Everketh is a 41-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling fish for ten years. Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and lack of modern preservation methods.

Her personal goals are educating her children and buying a car. Her business goals are diversifying her business, buying land to grow crops and moving the business to more permanent location. 

Everketh wants money to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Madame Maty  habite dans l’une des  banlieues  du Sénégal. Elle est veuve et évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Elle  vend  du savon liquide et autres produits de détergents divers. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Elle consacre 10  heures de temps de la journée à  son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la zone et sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir des produits qui seront destinés à la vente.  Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices,  d ‘augmenter le niveau de son épargne et de gérer  correctement les factures d’électricité de sa maison. Elle souhaite  rentabiliser ses économies et parvenir à financer son activité a travers son propre fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Maty lives in a Senegalese suburb. She is a widow, and works selling liquid soap and other miscellaneous detergent products. She has been working in this field for more than ten years, and each day she works for ten hours. She is a member of the area’s local U-IMCEC branch, and has requested a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase products which she will then sell. 

Maty hopes to increase her profits, see her savings grow and correctly manage her household electricity bills. She also plans to make the most of her savings and eventually finance her business through her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy detergent products for resale.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTOGBE 1 est formé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Kadégnon Philomène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la huitième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Kadégnon Philomène est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Andonin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Kadégnon Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Kadégnon Philomène vit ensemble avec sa famille et subvient ensemble avec son mari aux besoins du ménage. Kadégnon Philomène mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année la vente de divers. Kadégnon Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Kadégnon Philomène désire obtenir un huitième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 1. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesutogbe 1 group has seven members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Kadégnon Philomène, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the eighth time that this group has requested financial support from Alidé to expand their activity. 

Kadégnon Philomène is 42 years of age and is married to Andonin. The couple has four children in their care, all of whom are at school. Kadégnon herself did not go to school. She lives together with her family, and with her husband covers the household needs. Kadégnon Philomène has worked selling miscellaneous products for about ten years, and gets her supplies from a market in Benin. To increase the stock of her products and better meet the needs of her customers, Kadégnon Philomène has requested this eighth loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Jesutogbe 1 group. All their previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Martine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Martine est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Augustin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, mais un reste à leur charge. Martine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une quinzaine d’année, Martine vend des poissons frais et des condiments (piments secs, oignons, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Martine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Martine désire obtenir un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahugnon group has five members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is called Martine, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the sixth time that this group has requested the financial support of Alidé to expand their businesses. 

Martine is 44 years of age and married to Augustin. The couple has five children, all of whom have been provided with schooling, but only one child remains in their care. Martine herself did not go to school. She has sold fresh fish and seasonings (dry peppers, onions, etc.) in a market in Benin for the past 15 years. Martine gets her supplies in Benin. In order to increase the stock of her products and better meet the needs of her customers, Martine has requested a sixth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Mahugnon group. Their previous loans have all been repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, bags of dry peppers and onions.

loans.name: Elena Argentina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
La señora  Elena es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su situación económica. Tiene  70 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, una de ellos aun viven con ella con su familia.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, desde víveres hasta productos de bazar y también de papelería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayudan en su trabajo cuando esta  desocupad, pero por lo general es nuestra amiga la que mas pasa en su negocio ya que nos comenta que es allí donde le gusta estar ya que allí además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se entera de las novedades que pasan a sus alrededor. Tiene más de 20 años con su tienda negocio que tenia junto a su esposo y que al fallecer el ella tuvo que hacerse cargo para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, productos de bazar y papelería.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The May 3rd Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

Sra. Elena is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the help the loans have provided so that she can move forward in her business and improve her financial situation. She is 70 years old. It has been several years since her husband died, but their relationship resulted in five children, all of whom are grown. One child still lives with her.

Elena has a general store in her home where she sells all types of products, ranging from provisions to bazaar products, and also stationery. She works every day from 6am to 8pm, and sometimes much later. Her daughter helps her with her work when she is not busy, but in general, it is Elena who spends the most time at her business. She says that the part that she enjoys is being able to earn a living, as well as keeping herself entertained with all of the news that passes through the neighborhood. Elena and her husband managed this store together for more than 20 years, but when he died, she took over so that she could move forward.

This loan will be used to restock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, bazaar products, and stationery. Her dreams are to continue pressing forward and to have good health above all else.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, bazaar products, and stationery.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en alquiler en la zona Plan Autopista de la ciudad de La Paz.
Mario, trabaja más de diez horas como chofer en un sindicato de transporte publico y el crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia y con lo poco que gana solo le alcanza para pagar el alquiler de su casa y los gastos de alimentación para sus hijos ya que su esposa no le ayuda económicamente.
El sueño que tiene Mario, es poder tener una casa propia para darles más comodidad a sus hijos ya que están en etapa universitaria.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has four children. They live in a rented house in the Plan Autopista District of the city of La Paz.

Mario works more than 10 hours as a driver for a public transportation union. The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his vehicle since it is the only source of income by which he can support his family. With what little he earns, he can only pay for the rent and food for his children. His wife does not contribute financially.

Mario dreams of having a home of his own so that he can provide greater comfort for his children since they are at the stage of preparing for university. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Porvenir” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; Repostería,  confección, venta de ropa usada, venta de pan amasado, Artesanía en tejidos,  venta de accesorios en joyas, artesanía en bonsai, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de  San Fernando.
Leonardo, presidente del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste con una chaqueta color gris, pantalón blanco, su cabello lo usa corto.
El se dedica al rubro de la peluquería unisex, solo corta y peina, se ocupa de este negocio hace 26 años en el cual trabaja solo de lunes a sábado.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en un centro comercial que se especializa en vender productos de belleza cercano a su localidad, y en la ciudad de  Santiago compra las maquinas que necesita para su peluquería.
Con el crédito comprará maquinas para cortar cabellos, secador de pelo para su negocio.
Las metas en su negocio son prestar el mismo servicio pero de mejor calidad con mejor implementación para sus clientes.
Leonardo vive solo y uno de sus sueños es poder arreglar su casa.
El está muy contento y agradecido por la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómodo con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe confianza.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins, zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Porvenir” ["Future"]. It is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who dedicate themselves to different lines of work, including pastry making, dressmaking, used clothing sales, fresh bread sales, textile handicrafts, jewelry and accessory sales, bonsai crafts, and services, among others. All of them live in the city of San Fernando.

Leonardo is the president of the communal bank group. In the photo, he is in the row of people standing, the first one going from right to left, dressed in a gray jacket and light colored pants, and with short hair. 

He works providing unisex hair salon services, only cutting and styling. He has operated this business for 26 years, and he works alone from Monday through Saturday. 

He buys the supplies he needs from a shopping center near his location which specializes in selling beauty products, and he buys the equipment he needs for his hair salon in the city of Santiago.

With the loan, he will buy equipment for cutting hair as well as a hair dryer for his business. His goals for his business are to provide the same service but of higher quality with better infrastructure for his customers. 

Leonardo lives alone, and one of his dreams is to be able to fix up his house. He is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided to him by the Esperanza Fund to invest in his business. He also feels very comfortable with the group in which he participates, since they are united and have confidence in each other. 

San Fernando is a city located in the Liberator General Bernardo O'Higgins Region, in the central part of Chile. The city's economic activity is mainly centered on agriculture (vineyards, beet growing, fruit orchards, tobacco, wheat and traditional crops), agroindustry (companies exporting fruit, preserves, dairy products, etc.), and trade.

loans.use: to buy haircutting equipment and a hair dryer for his business.

loans.name: Davide

texts.en:
Davide, who arrived in her current region from another part of Northern Albania some years ago, is a mother of six children ranging from 11 to 26 years of age. Four of them are still attending school with one of them studying in university; another one is in high school and the other two still in elementary school. She and her family were challenged at first in the new location, however, thanks to VisionFund Albania loans and their hard work, their living condition improved. 

Davide's business of over four years has included raising and selling piglets on the local market. At the moment, she still has a sow (female pig) however, it's growing older and its productivity has decreased. This is the reason why Davide wants to invest on two more sows. Her business has been successful so far and with its profit she was able to pay off the two previous loans, raise her children and make some basic renovations to her home. 

Now, her plans include expansion of the business and sending the other three children to university.

loans.use: To buy two sows (female pigs)

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is married and has nine children. They all live in Northern Albania. Her oldest child is 40 years old and the youngest one is 19 years old. She has been in the livestock business for almost nine years, selling dairy products and cattle to the locals. The demand for both has been high and she is known to a wide clientele in the region. In the past nine years, Marte has been the only financial support for her family and that makes her feel proud. Other family members including her husband and grown-up children have helped in the business as well.

Marte had a cow before, but when one of her sons got married recently, she gave it to him as a gift. Now, she is looking at buying a new one of the same breed as the previous one. Marte has proved in the past that she is a very responsible person; she always managed to pay the monthly loan installments before time.

Continuing being in the same business will help Marte improve her family's living conditions and add some more rooms to their existing two-room house.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Veni Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad y aún viven con ella, uno de ellos es discapacitado. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo a llevar la dura carga de mantener el hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice para su trabajo, el esposo tiene cultivos de maíz, maní y necesita del crédito para poder pagar la mano de obra para poder recolectar los frutos y con esto poder mantenerse hasta que los pueda vender a mejor precio ya que en la actualidad los precios están muy bajos y son los comerciantes mayoristas los que se le llevarían la ganancia si los vende en estos momentos, por eso el crédito le permite pagar y luego vender y así tener mejores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Con él trabajan además de sus hijos cuatro personas más a quienes les paga por su trabajo, hasta que termine la recolección de los frutos.

Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra. Esta casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The members of the Estancia Vieja communal bank meet every 15 days in Estancia Vieja in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo.   It is a place with humble people who are devoted to agriculture and general commerce.

This is where we meet Mariana, age 57.  She is married, and they have two children.  Both children are adults, and they still live with her.  One of them is disabled.  Her husband devotes himself to agriculture.  

In order to help her husband with the difficult responsibility of supporting the household, our friend gets a loan for him to use with his work.  He has corn and peanut crops.  He needs the loan to be able to pay for the labor to harvest the crops.  With this help he will be able to get by until he is able to sell for a better price.

Prices are currently very low, and the wholesale merchants are the ones who will get the earnings if he sells to them at this time.  Therefore, the loan will allow him to pay and later sell.  This way he will get better income for his family’s well-being.  In addition to his children working with him, there are four more people whom he pays to work until they finish harvesting the crops.

This loan is to pay for labor.  She has been in the communal bank almost since it began.  She likes it for the ease of getting the loans.

Her dream is to have a food store.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Luigj

texts.en:
Luigj is a Romani man from the Albanian Roma ethnic community. He is married with two children, 26 and 20 years of age. It’s his first time applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania. 

Luigj has had his business in construction and also in collecting scrap metal and plastic for resale. He has been doing this for over twenty years and doing very well at both. Recently, he was able to use his savings to buy better building tools to use in construction. His wife collected scrap as well until recently when she unfortunately, became semi-paralyzed.  

Now, Luigj is looking to finance a new venture for his wife and their 20-year-old unemployed son, a poultry business. There has been a high demand for eggs and poultry in the region. Based on experts' estimate in the field, the net revenue of one month can add up to 250,000 ALL. He has already contacted potential buyers. He smiles and says, “with help and support from good people, everything will be in order and what's more important, my wife will feel useful and happy.”

loans.use: To buy 100 chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en:
Besnik is a thirty-three-year-old Romani man from the Roma ethnic group of Albania. He is married with three children; six and three years old and seven-months old. It’s his first time applying for a loan. 

Besnik has been in the business of making wall bricks/blocks and vineyard concrete pillars over the past eight years. The manufacturing tools that Besnik has been using since the beginning have been very primitive.  He is now seeking to buy a machine to make the products. This will not only make his work much faster and easier but also will enable him to produce more. 

Besnik is the only wall brick/block and vineyard pillar maker in the entire district and the demand for such items is extremely high, since Albania is still a country under development. He is not only confident of paying back the full loan on time, but also plans to finance a new livestock business for his wife.

His dreams are that someday his family will be able to live in a nice house and also his children will get access to higher education.

loans.use: To purchase brick/block and vineyard pillar making machine

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth vive con sus esposos y su hijo de 4 años, en el municipio de San Jacinto, población ubicada en el departamento de Bolívar, de tradición artesanal,  donde se dedica a la producción de bolsos y mochilas y además genera otros ingresos realizando tareas de manicurista en parte de su tiempo. La tradición familiar influyó en el desarrollo de este tipo de negocio, porque desde pequeña vio a su madre hacerlo, así fue que cuando contrajo matrimonio, decidió genera ingresos mediante este oficio. Su esposo también es comerciante de leche, que compra directamente en las fincas y distribuye al detal entre vendedores. Los principales clientes de Lisbeth son los almacenes y turistas que han sido remitidos a ella. En la actualidad requiere hacer reparaciones a su máquina de coser los bolsos, pues desea tenerla en perfecto estado, para prestar en el barrio donde vive,  el servicio de costura y elaborar prendas infantiles a precios mucho mas competitivos, que los que ella ve que comercializan en el pueblo. Su mayor desafío es tener un suficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr el crecimiento empresarial al que aspira, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará hilos en mayor volumen, reparará su maquina de coser y comprará insumos para continuar fortaleciendo el servicio de manicure y pedicure. La razón de éxito de esta inversión radica en su experiencia en la tarea, en que   hace su inversión en una temporada en la cual le han hecho muchos pedidos que le suman a sus ingresos y en que las compras en mayor volumen resultan con muy buenos descuentos que benefician sus ingresos..
texts.en:
Lisbeth lives with her husband and four-year-old son in the town of San Jacinto, which is located in the Department of Bolívar. This area is known for its traditional craftsmanship. Lisbeth produces bags and backpacks, but she also earns extra income by working part-time as a manicurist. Family tradition influenced her to start this type of business. When she was younger, Lisbeth would watch her mother make things, so she decided to earn income in this manner when she got married. Her husband works as a milk dealer. He buys directly from the farms and distributes it to different vendors.

Lisbeth's main customers are the shops and tourists that have been referred to her. At the moment, she performs repair work on the bags with the use of her sewing machine because she wants to keep them in perfect condition. She also provides sewing services in the neighborhood where she lives. Lisbeth produces children's clothes at very competitive prices and then sells them in town. Her greatest challenge is having a sufficient amount of operating capital so that she can grow her business. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy thread in bulk, repair her sewing machine, and purchase supplies for strengthening her manicure and pedicure business. The reason why her investment will be successful is because she has experience. During this season, she receives many orders to help raise her income. By purchasing in large volumes, Lisbeth will be able to receive good discounts that will benefit her bottom line.

loans.use: to buy thread in bulk, to repair her sewing machine, and to purchase supplies for her manicure business.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is married and has eight children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. Helaria started her sari-sari store (general store) three years ago. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, snack foods, and canned goods. 

Helaria is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, and toiletries. She would like her sales and profitability to increase.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Nivet Yadine

texts.es:
Nivet vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener una preciosas playas en las cuales uno puede gozar de lo hermoso de su paisaje, también se desarrolla la pesca y la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo, también podemos encontrar variedad de platos típicos pero en especial el riquísimo Chupe de Camarones. Cuando Nivet tiene un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear sobre todo para distraerse y alejar el mal humor; aprovecha en ocasiones de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Con entusiasmo Nivet trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Nivet está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio en especial ropa de invierno como chompas, pantalones, casacas, entre otros, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, con esta mejora podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Formar una familia y darle lo mejor”.
texts.en:
Nivet lives in the city of Camana, a city that is characterized by having some beautiful beaches where one can enjoy the beauty of the countryside.  It also has developed fishing and agriculture, especially rice, where it is considered to be one of the best locations in the world.  We can also find a variety of typical dishes here, especially the extremely delicious "Chupe de Camarones" [a kind of shrimp soup].  When Nivet has free time, she enjoys going for walks, especially to distract herself and improve a bad mood.  Occasionally she will take advantage of this to eat one of her favorite dishes which is the extremely delicious "Lomo Saltado" [marinated and stir-fried strips of beef].

Nivet works enthusiastically in her business selling clothing.  She works in her business for around ten hours a day, and can serve up to 20 customers each day.  She believes that things are going well for her in her business because she is very friendly, and above all because all the products that she offers for sale are good quality at a reasonable price.

Nivet is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support they provided she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business.  In particular, she will purchase special winter clothes such as sweaters, trousers, and jackets among other things.  In this way she will be able to improve her income and have a greater variety of products to offer for sale to her customers.  With this improvement, she will be able to continue working to be able to make her most important dream a reality:  "To have a family, and to give them only the best"

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (sweaters, trousers, and jackets, among other things)

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 57 years old, married and the mother of seven children who range in age from 15 and 32 years old. She earns a living by running a coconut farm and selling the copra (or dried coconut kernel)  that she makes. She also earns money on the side by fishing. She works together with her husband, and the couple do their very best to meet their family's needs and pay their children's school fees. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and fishing nets. Pacita hopes to be successful in all of her ventures, and hopes that one day her family will be out of difficulties and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fishing nets.

loans.name: Musowa

texts.en:
Musowa is 54 years old, married, and has seven children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in video shows for two years.  

Musowa is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy a digital satellite television. His hardships include inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. His business goals are diversifying his business, moving his business to more permanent location, and expanding his business to new markets. Musowa's personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home, and self education.

loans.use: to purchase a digital satellite television.

loans.name: Romizan

texts.en:
Romizan (in the photo) is 26 years old, and her husband, Ahmat, is 27 years old. They have been married since 2008 and live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two young children: one son and one daughter. Romizan's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia.

Romizan and her husband are fishermen. She has applied for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
LUIS ALFREDO tiene 37 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

LUIS ALFREDO es ayudante de cerrajeria. Soliicita el crédito para comprar repuestos de carro tales cómo eje, aros, rulimanes, además para comprar un armario.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los respuestos para el auto y  en efectivo. Las compras lo hará en Guaranda.

El sueño es poder tener una familia grande y saludables. El desafío al que se enfrenta es poder tener un negocio propio. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear. y paracticar el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 37 years of age, is married without children, and lives with his parents in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar. He works an assistant in a welding shop.


He has requested this loan to purchase car parts such as an axle, piston rings and roller bearings, as well as to buy a wardrobe. With the help of the loan he can buy these parts in cash. Luis Alfredo plans to make these purchases in Guaranda.


Luis Alfredo’s dream is to have a large, healthy family. The challenge he faces is opening his own business. In his free time he likes to go for walks and play sports.

loans.use: to buy car parts such as an axle, piston rings and roller bearings, as well as to buy a wardrobe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La Sra. Inés tiene  42 años no es casada pero tiene dos hijos  que son de las edades de 9 y 7 años, ella es agricultora tiene su parcela que se encuentra la localidad de San Carlos Limoncito, La Sra. Inés es cliente antigua de la institución, ya que  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia, la Sra. Inés  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de semillas para la siembra de zanahoria y caba de yuca y también para los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la falta de capital para la siembra de zanahoria, la Sra. Ines enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando la siembra la cosecha de sus productos, el vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years of age and is not married, but has two children who are aged nine and seven. She works in agriculture, and has her own plot of land located in San Carlos Limoncito.

Inés is a past client of this institution, as this is her second loan. She plans to use this loan to buy seeds to plant carrots and cassava, as well as to cover the costs involved in preparing the land.  She has requested the loan as she has no money to buy carrot seeds. 

Inés faces challenges in her business, including improving her quality of life. She plans to use the profits she earns to improve the planting and harvesting of her produce, which she sells in the town market directly to her customers.

loans.use: to plant carrots and cassava.

loans.name: Josè Faustino

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 23 años de  edad, de estado civil conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su cónyuge en  el domicilio de su padre, en el caserío Sialupe Baca del distrito de Lambayeque .La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría son trabajadores independientes dedicados al  comercio, crianza de animales y adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Además solo  cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de norias artesanales.

La actividad principal a la que se dedica José  es la crianza/venta  de  animales como: Caprinos, porcinos y aves de corral, donde los alimenta a base de concentrado, y cuando alcanzan el tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; José cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Su cónyuge también le apoya en esta actividad,

El  monto del préstamo solicitado por  José es de S/. 800 nuevos soles, y será para compra de animales y alimentos balanceados para engorde. Actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario, debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona, y esto le va permitir mejorar su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 23 years of age, lives with his partner and has no children. He lives with his partner in his father’s house in the small area of Sialupe Baca, located in the district of Lambayeque. The quality of life in this community is subsistence level. Most people who live here are self-employed and work selling goods, raising animals and also in agriculture. They only have electricity services, and water is obtained through traditional watermills.


José mainly works in raising and selling animals such as goats, pigs and free-range poultry. He feeds them on concentrated feed and, when they have reached the right size and weight, sells them to wholesalers in the area. José has three years’ experience in this kind of business, and his live-in partner also supports him in this business.


José has requested a loan of 800 nuevos soles, which he will use to buy animals and balanced feed for fattening. He plans to increase his stock as his business is profitable in this area, and this will allow him to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed for fattening.

loans.name: Rosa Flor

texts.es:
Rosa es un  mujer muy trabajadora y carismática, es madre de un pequeño de 5 años al quien saca adelante sola ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y desde ese entonces se convirtió en padre y madre para su pequeño. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de los Aquijes, Ica, Perú. El distrito de los Aquijes se caracteriza porque en el se encuentran las Bodegas donde se produce nuestro licor Bandera el cual es el Pisco, asimismo en el se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, mango, algodón, pallares, frejoles, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Rosa le gusta coser ropa pero también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato con papa a la Huancaína”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar derecho.

Día a día Rosa trabaja muy alegre en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender  hasta 6 clientes de manera diaria; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y amable con los clientes.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como polos, faldas, lencería, pantalones, blusas, entre otros; así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un Bazar y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working, charismatic woman. She is the mother of a 5-year-old child who she raises alone, as her husband left her and her child. Since then, she has been both father and mother to her son. Her home is located in the Los Aquijes district of Ica, in Peru. This neighborhood is known as home to the facilities which make Pisco, the country’s national liqueur. The neighborhood is also well-known for its agriculture, particularly the growing of grapes, mangos, cotton, butter beans and beans, among others. 

In her free time Rosa likes to sew, as well as to eat one of her favorite dishes - “Arroz con Pato con papa a la Huancaína” (rice with duck and Huancayo-style potatoes). She only attended high school, but would have liked to study law. Every day Rosa happily goes to work in her clothing sales business, where she works for around ten hours a day and can handle up to six customers. She thinks that her business is going well because she is charismatic and very friendly with her customers.


Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they will give her, she will be able to buy more goods for her business: polo shirts, skirts, underwear, pants and blouses, among others. This will allow her to keep working and fulfill her biggest dream – to have a stationery shop and ensure her son gets a good education.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (polo shirts, skirts, underwear, pants and blouses, among others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Teang

texts.en: Teang is 51 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, where she and her husband have earned a living by fishing for more than 20 years. They earn about $12 per day, and one of her children works in a garment factory and earns about $3 a day. Because transportation is a big problem for this family, Teang is requesting a loan for $1,300 to buy a motorbike to use when commuting. This will allow her to save the money she and her family currently spend on transportation, and use it instead to improve the family's living conditions. In the future, she would like to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees so that they can all get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use when commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Emprendedores Lord Cochrane Group

texts.es:
Este Banco se llama “Emprendedores Lord Cochrane” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales  encuentran; ventas de plantas, bazar, artesanía en tejidos, confección de ropa, venta de accesorios en joyas. Todos ellos pertenecientes  a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Geanella, Secretaria del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón azul, con una polera de rayas color rojo y encima una chaqueta color gris.
Ella se dedica al rubro de artesanía y Bazar, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 6 años y trabaja junto a su madre.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en Santiago, por la variedad de productos y a un menor costo.
Con el crédito comprara chalecos de diferentes modelos y tallas para su clientela.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio y aumentar sus ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Geanella vive junto a su marido quien se desempeña como Funcionario de la Armada, además su madre, abuela y su futuro hijo. Sus sueños son poder tener una casa propia.
Geanella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, Además comenta que se siente muy bien con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que son unidos.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This bank is called “Emprendedores Lord Cochrane” (Lord Cochrane Entrepreneurs), and has 17 members involved in different businesses: plant sales, stationery items, traditional woven products, tailoring, jewelry and accessory sales, among others. All of the members are from the city of Valparaíso.

Geanella, who is the secretary of the village bank, is seated first from right to left in the photo, and is wearing blue pants, a red striped top and a grey jacket. She has sold traditionally crafted products and stationery items for the past six years, and works alongside her mother. She buys the goods she needs for her business in Santiago, where there is greater variety and costs are lower.

Geanella plans to use the loan to buy vests of different styles and sizes for her customers. Her future goals include continuing with her business and increasing her income, enabling her to have a better quality of life. She lives with her husband, who is a government employee and works for the navy, as well as her mother and grandmother. She is also expecting a baby. Her dream is to have her own home.


Geanella is very happy and thankful for the loan and services offered by Fondo Esperanza. She also says that she feels very good about the meetings and the group of people included in the village bank, as they are all united.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers to the north-west of Santiago. It is the regional capital and home to the country’s legislative authorities. It is Chile’s main port, and has a wide variety of beautiful, picturesque spots, such as the home of poet and Nobel prize winner Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy vests of different styles and sizes for her customers.

loans.name: Melvy

texts.es: La Sra. Melvy tiene  31 años no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene tres hijos  que son de las edades de 9, 7 y 5 años, ella es agricultora tiene su parcela que se encuentra la localidad de Sombrerito, La Sra. Melvy es cliente antigua de la institución, ya que  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia, la Sra. Melvy  va a usar este préstamo  para los gastos que implica el mantenimiento de plantines y plantas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la falta de capital para el mantenimiento de sus plantas, la Sra. Melvy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando sus productos, la Sra. Es una persona muy amable se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Melvy is 31 years of age and is not married. She lives with her partner with whom she has three children, aged nine, seven and five. She works in agriculture and has a plot of land located in Sombrerito.

Melvy is a past client of this institution, and this is her second loan. She plans to use the loan to cover the expenses involved in looking after her seedlings and plants. She has asked for this loan as she does not have enough money to take care of her plants. Melvy faces challenges in her business, such as improving her quality of life, and plans to use the profits she generates to continue improving her produce. She is a friendly person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: to look after her seedlings.

loans.name: Sandra Evy

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera,  Vive en casa de sus  padres, en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura. Donde cuenta solamente con  los servicios básicos de luz y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de norias artesanales; bajo estas condiciones viven casi todas las familias de esta zona.

 La actividad que desarrolla Sandra es la venta de productos de belleza, este negocio lo tiene en su propio domicilio y cuenta con clientes ya fidelizados; en este tipo de negocio tiene aproximadamente 2 años. Además  cuenta con empleo como secretaria en la municipalidad de Tambogrande, donde le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales.

Sandra esta Solicitando un crédito por S/. 1,000 nuevos soles, lo cual lo necesita para la compra de  productos de belleza, ya que cuenta con pedidos por parte de su clientela, de esta forma le va permitir mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Sandra is a 27-year-old woman. She is single, and lives in her parents’ house in the rural part of the Tambogrande district, located in the region of Piura. This area only has basic electricity services, and water is obtained through traditional watermills. All the families in this area live under these conditions.


Sandra works selling beauty products. Her business is located in her home, and she has loyal customers. She has had this business for approximately two years. She also works as a secretary in the town of Tambogrande, which allows her to earn additional income.


Sandra has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles. She plans to use this money to buy beauty products, as her customers have already placed orders. This will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer muy humilde y carismática, vive al lado de su esposo quien es su mano derecha y su mayor apoyo, juntos tienen un hijo de 15 años de edad, al cual quieren mucho a pesar de que por su edad le saca canas verdes y por quien trabaja día a día para darle lo necesario para tener una vida feliz y con amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por encontrarse en la selva peruana, en el habitan flora y fauna maravillosa, tiene un clima cálido y es un lugar donde uno puede relajarse y apreciar la gran belleza de la naturaleza. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su familia y también en ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”.

Con entusiasmo Norma trabaja día a día en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 50 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo a precios cómodos y también por su amabilidad en la atención.

Norma está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como ropa para niños, blusas para damas, pantalones, entre otros. De esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorara sus ingresos, así ella seguirá trabajando día a día ´para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su taller de confección”.
texts.en:
Norma is a very humble and charismatic woman. She lives with her husband, who she relies on and is her main support. They have a 15-year-old son who, even though they love him very much, sometimes drives them crazy because of his age. Norma works every day to ensure that her son has everything he needs and to have a happy life full of love. 


Her home is located in the city of Pucallpa in the Peruvian jungle, surrounded by marvelous flora and fauna. It has a warm climate, and is an ideal place to relax and appreciate the beauty of nature. When Norma has some spare time she likes to go for walks with her family, as well as to eat one of her favorite dishes, ceviche.


Norma works enthusiastically in her clothes sales business every day. She works around 12 hours daily and can handle up to 50 customers. She thinks that her business is going well because she offers quality products and, above all, because her prices are accessible and she is friendly to her customers.


Norma would like to thank the Kiva lenders, as their help will allow her to buy more goods for her business, such as children’s clothing, women’s blouses and pants, among others. This will enable her to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and her income will improve. She will continue working every day to realize her biggest dream – to have her own clothing workshop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (children’s clothing, women’s blouses and pants, among others).

loans.name: Laura Beatriz

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Laura, tiene 34 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  15, 13 y 8 años de edad,  los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
Nuestra amiga para salir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, nos cuenta que este es un trabajo muy duro pero por sus hijos  lo hace  ya ella es madre y padre a la vez, nos cuenta que también de viernes  a domingo por las tardes ella vende salchichas asadas, instala en su casa un pequeño local en el cual vende este delicioso plato, ella aprovecha que en estos días muchas personas llegan hasta una cancha cercana  a hacer deportes, por eso vede en estos días ya que es cuando más personas llegan, allí también vende gaseosas, aguas y jugos, lleva ya más de 5 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo y así salir adelante.

Este crédito es para compara salchichas, gaseosas, aguas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 10 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por ala ayuda que le brinda el banco.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the village bank known as Estancia Vieja meet in the neighborhood of Estancia Vieja, located in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. This area is home to humble people who work in agriculture and general trade.


Laura, who is 34 years of age, lives in this area. She is separated, and has three children aged 15, 13 and eight from her prior relationship. Her older children are in high school, and the youngest is in elementary school. To get ahead in life and ensure the best for her children, she works in agriculture. She says that this is hard work, but she carries on for her children, for whom she is both mother and father. 


From Friday to Sunday she sells roast sausages in the evenings. She has set up a small store in her home where she sells this delicious dish. She takes advantage of these days because many people go to a nearby sports area to take part in sports. These are the days when the most people are in the area. She also sells sodas, water and juices, and has had this business for more than five years, helping her to earn more and get ahead in life.


She plans on using this loan to buy sausages, sodas and water, among other items. She has had ten loan cycles with the village bank, and is thankful for the help she has received. Her dream is to see her children have a professional career.

loans.use: To buy sausages, sodas, water, etc.

loans.name: Mariama  Mamadou

texts.fr: Madame Mariama Mamadou  est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active  dans le secteur du commerce depuis plusieurs années et  vend des produits saisonniers comme les  mangues et divers  autres produits alimentaires pour enfants. Dans le but de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise et rendre plus rentable son activité , elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour financer un voyage vers un pays limitrophe du Sénégal  ou elle pourra se  procurer des parfums  et des tissus qui seront destinés a la vente. Le développement de son activité commerciale et l’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettent  de gérer  ses besoins personnels, d’accroitre son épargne et de participer très positivement à l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en: Mariama Mamadou is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been an active trader for several years and sells seasonal products such as mangoes and other food products for children. With a view to diversify the products she sells and make her business more profitable, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs, with which she plans to finance a trip to a country which borders on Senegal, where she can get perfumes and fabrics to sell on. The development of her business and increase in profits enable her to manage her personal needs, boost her savings and contribute significantly to the improvement in her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to travel and buy products to sell

loans.name: Felipe Santiago
