María lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for having a hot climate all year which is why it’s known as the land of eternal sun.  It’s also an agricultural center especially cotton, paprika, grapes and asparagus, among other crops.  Like all good Peruvians, she very much enjoys our country’s typical dishes, especially the very delicious “Sopa Seca.”  She only attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied Administration.

María works day to day in her business selling clothes on order.  She spends about four hours daily in her business.  She also has a business leasing a mototaxi and also sells hamburgers at night.  She believes that she does well in her business because she treats her customers in a kind way.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will buy more merchandise like jackets, pants, sweatshirts and coats in order to have a wider variety of products and to improve her income to continue working towards making her greatest dream come true: to build her house out of substantial materials because when the 2007 earthquake occurred it collapsed.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Lansana A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers from the eastern city of Kenema. These borrowers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 6,000,000 SLL in order to meet their variegated personal financial needs. 

Lansana is a teacher at the school and leader of this group. Fifty-year-old Lansana was born in a place called Largo. He is married with six children, two of whom are attending secondary schools and four of whom are in college. Lansana has been in the teaching profession for thirty-six years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials including iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, rods, and nails for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials including iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, rods, and nails for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура –участница группы "Тансулуу". Айнуре 36 лет. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 2006 году Айнура начала  заниматься животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы, Айнура имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса за счет полеводства, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян хлопка. Доходы Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Ainura is a participant of the "Tansuluu" group.  She is 36 years old.  To provide a source of income for her family, Ainura became involved in animal husbandry in 2006.  Having two dairy cows in her business, she has a monthly profit in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business through farming, Ainura requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy mineral fertilizers and cotton seeds.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Paizbubu

texts.ru: Паизбубу  –участница группы «Тансулуу». Паизбубу 52 года. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Паизбубу занимается животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 4 дойные коровы, 8 овец, Паизбубу имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса за счет полеводства, Паизбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян хлопка и  минеральных удобрений. Доходы Паизбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Paizbubu is a participant of the "Tansuluu" group.  She is 52 years old.  To provide a source of income for her family, Paizbubu is involved in animal husbandry.  Having four dairy cows and eight sheep in her business, she has a monthly profit in the amount of 6,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business through farming, Paizbubu requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and cotton seeds

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, es una mujer viuda de 60 años, vive sola en su casa propia, ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. 
Durante 22 años se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto que implementó en su casa. Después de que falleció su esposo tuvo que salir adelante por sí misma, es por ello que su mayor tiempo lo dedicó a su negocio. Margarita comenta que desde que empezó a trabajar con los préstamos de MFP le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas, y por ello su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.

Este es su préstamo número 15 con MFP, se siente muy contenta de saber que una vez más contará con el apoyo financiero para seguir cumpliendo con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar con personas responsables y que cumplen con su deber. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita se abastecerá de mercadería (sacos de arroz, conservas, cereales, entre otros) para implementara su tienda.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 60 year old widow.  She lives alone in her own house because her children are all independent adults.

She’s sold groceries for 22 years in a stand she set up at home.  When he husband died she had to get ahead on her own which is why she spends most of her time in her business.    Margarita comments that since she started working with MFP loans she’s done very well with her sales and her greatest hope is to expand the business to increase profits.

This is her 15th loan with MFP.  She feels very happy to know that once again she can count on financial support to continue with her business plan.  
She also thanks her communal bank for working with responsible people who keep their commitments.

She will use the 2000 new soles she’s asking for now to stock up on merchandise (sacks of rice, conserves, and cereals, among others) for her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margot tiene 38 años, es una mujer valiente y esforzada, quien junto a sus hijos; Cristian de 15 años y Danny de 8 años, vive en su casa propia.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de todo tipo de calzado, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Para ella su trabajo es lo más favorable que puede realizar, porque también le da tiempo para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos, quienes son estudiantes. Por otro lado, lo que le resulta dificultoso es cuando su puesto se queda casi vacío y no tiene mercadería. 
Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales y por el momento prioriza el incrementar su negocio con modelos exclusivos de zapatos para atraer más clientela.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo económico. Así también se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y partícipe de las reuniones.
Con el préstamo que ahora solicita viajará a la ciudad para comprar los mejores zapatos de temporada.
texts.en:
Margoth, 38, is a brave, dedicated woman who together with her children, Cristian, 15 and Danny, 8 lives in her own house.

The activity she carries out is the sale of all types of footwear; she has a stand in her local market.  For her, work is the most beneficial thing she can do because it also gives her time to take care of her children who are students.  On the other hand, what’s difficult for her is when her stand is almost empty and she runs out of merchandise.

Her greatest hope is that her children become professionals and for the moment she’s prioritizing her business’ growth with exclusive styles of shoes to attract more customers.

This is her second MFP loan.  She feels grateful to know that she can continue to count on economic support.  At the same time, she commits to continue being punctual with her installment payments.  She’s an active, participatory member in her communal bank meetings.

She will use the loan she’s requesting now to travel to the city to buy the best shoes that are in season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 64 años, es padre y madre para sus dos hijos; Liliana de 26 y Clever de 24 años, quienes siguen al lado su padre apoyándolo en todo momento. Juntos viven en la casa que llegaron a comprar con su difunta esposa.

Desde que la esposa de Mario falleció tuvo que hacerse cargo, sólo, del puesto de zapatos que tienen en el mercado de su localidad. Así como también velar por los estudios de sus hijos y su bienestar. Desde los 24 años ya tenía el conocimiento sobre este negocio, y con su amabilidad y buena atención logra que los clientes se acerquen a comprarle los diferentes modelos que ofrece. 
Mario comenta que siempre tiene ingresos y le va muy bien con sus ventas, por tal motivo acude a los créditos de MFP para cumplir con sus objetivos futuros.

Éste es su préstamo número 13 con MFP, por ello se siente contento de saber que, una vez más, cuenta con este apoyo. Se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus cuotas y agradece a su banco comunal por ser personas de mucha responsabilidad.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprará variedad de calzado para incrementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Mario, 64, is both father and mother to his two children, Liliana, 26, and Clever, 24, who continue at their father’s side supporting him at all times.  They live together in the house he managed to buy with his late wife.

Since his wife died, Mario has had to take over the operation of the shoe stand they have in the local market alone as well as to watch over his children’s schooling and wellbeing.  He’s been knowledgeable about this type of business since the age of 24 and with his kindness and good service he succeeds in having customers approach to buy the various styles he sells.

Mario comments that he always has income and does well with his sales which is why he calls on MFP loans to reach his future objectives.  This is his loan #13 with MFP which is why he feels happy to know, once again, that he can count on this support.  He commits to continue to be punctual with his payments and he thanks his communal band for being very responsible people.

He will use the requested loan to buy a variety of shoes to stock his sales stand.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Odilboi

texts.ru: Одилбой женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он очень заботливый отец и всегда старается подарит своим детям счастье. Чтобы содержать свою семью он начал заниматься скотоводством и более 10 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Кроме купле- продажи скота он параллельно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Отходы от сельхозкультур идут на корм скота и поэтому ему выгодно содержать скот. В бизнесе помогает жена. Одилбой хочет расширить свой бизнес и он хотел бы получить займ для покупки 8 голов скота для откорма.  Одилбой надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Odilboi is married and raising four children.  He is a very caring father and always tries to provide happiness for his children.  He became involved in animal husbandry in order to support his family and has been in this business for ten years.  Besides buying and selling livestock, he is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  Odilboi wants to expand his business very much and wants to obtain this loan to buy eight heads of livestock for fattening up.  Odilboi relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is married with 5 children. Efren is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Efren is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years and every month he earn PHP 5,630 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Efren been a member of GDMPC just this year. In the future, Efren hopes to finish supporting the studies of his children and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary es una joven madre de 20 años. Vive en la casa de sus padres, junto su pequeña hija Nayely de 3 añitos, a quien desea brindar una buena calidad de vida y un mejor futuro. 
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que logró implementar gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes se esmeran porque salga adelante junto a su pequeña hija. Desde hace dos años que realiza esta labor, en la cual le va muy bien, ya que cuenta con clientes constantes. Su puesto se ubica en el mercado de su localidad y a pesar de la competencia, con su amabilidad, ella obtiene más clientes. Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan en algunas ocasiones.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brindan. Asimismo agradece a sus compañeros del banco comunal por permitirle trabajar con ellos y se compromete ser puntual con los pagos mensuales.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que Mary solicita abastecerá de mercadería su puesto.
texts.en:
Mary, 20, is a young mother living in her parents’ house with her three year old little girl, Nayely. She sells groceries, a business she was able to start thanks to support from her parents who strive so that she can get ahead with her little daughter.  

She’s been in this work for two years and does very well since she has regular customers.  Her stand is located in the local market and despite competition she gets more customers thanks to her kindness.  Her greatest hope is to be able to continue forward despite difficulties that arise on occasion.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s happy about the support she gets.  She also thanks her communal bank members for allowing her to work with them and she commits to be punctual with her monthly payments.

Mary will use the requested 2000 new soles to stock her stand with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is 55 years old and lives alone in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her children live apart from her and her husband passed away recently. She started her garment retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. Her product range is wide and her counter is in an excellent location. Her current demand is high; therefore, she needs to increase her supplies in order to meet her demand. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I cant stand to burden my children. Besides, I love what I do." She's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer muy responsable y laboriosa. Tiene 31 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Richard, de 32 años, y su hija Sheila de 9 años; a quien le brindan amor y desean ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 11 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Él la apoya en las ventas y es quien viaja a la ciudad para la compra de la mercadería. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar a la ciudad, porque corre el riesgo de que puedan robarle sus prendas.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP y se siente contenta por trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que son personas solidarias y comprometidas.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprará variedad de ropa, tanto como para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a very hard working and responsible woman. She is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Richard, who is 32 years old and her daughter, Sheila, who is 9 years old. She loves her daughter very much and wants to be able to provide her with a better quality of life. 

She makes a living selling clothing from a stand in her local market. She has been doing this type of work for the past 11 years, and has been supported by her husband in her business. He supports her in her sales and is also who travels to the city to buy the merchandise she sells. The thing she likes most about her work is that it allows her to pay the household expenses. The thing she considers most difficult about her business is having to go to the city to buy merchandise, because it means risking being robbed. 

This is her 13th loan with MFP. She is very happy to work with this communal bank because the members are supportive and committed. With the loan she has requested she will buy a variety of clothing, for children, teenagers and adults.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie lives in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He earns a living through providing transportation services, which he has been doing for 5 years to support the needs of his 2 children. He gets an income of PHP 5,000 a month for this business. For a 42-year old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy but to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Ronnie wants to borrow PHP 10,000 from GDMPC Microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children a better education. He is new to GDMPC. His plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell for her business.

Cristita has been in this business for 30 years. Cristita earns additional income from a general store.

Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Originally from Columbia, Andres decided to move to the United States to find more opportunity for himself and better his life. He moved to New York and began to work for a transporting company that specialized in the delivery of different antiques and other furniture. After gaining good experience at this company, Andres wanted to live out his dream of becoming his own boss. He never felt right working for someone else and when the opportunity was right, he decided to branch off and embark on his own venture. With some of his pre-existing clients from his previous company, he was able to start his own company. His company took off and now employs three full-time employees. Andres loves what he does now and feels so grateful for the opportunities that he has been allotted. His trucks are old though and could use a great deal of repairs. Andres would like to use this loan to repair his trucks and grow his business even further.

loans.use: to make repairs on his moving trucks

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en:
Sam Oeurn is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a coconut vendor who earns about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam Oeurn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry coconuts to sell. This purchase will help her husband carry coconuts to sell in larger amounts and to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry coconuts to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 59 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 3 children. 
James has a store that sells general merchandise and other consumable products. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used in purchasing additional stock for sale.
James has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, James hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 
Erlinda has a general store that sells merchandise and other consumable products. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for almost 8 years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Virne

texts.en: Virne, 30 years old, is a married entrepreneur living in San Roque, Panaon with 3 children. He is earning income from his transport service business. He has been in business for almost 3 years now and he earns PHP 6,000 per month. To improve business, he would like to borrow PHP 10,000 from GDMPC Microcredit which he just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful that he will be able to his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 38 años, vive en una casa alquilada. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y empeñoso, con ganas de salir adelante. 
Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 8 años, comenta que le ha ido muy bien, ya que tiene la amabilidad como estrategia para atender a sus clientes. Esta labor lo realiza solo y lo que más le gusta es poder contar con ingresos por un negocio propio. Nos cuenta que en la temporada de mucho calor es cuando tiene más clientela. Por ello su prioridad es incrementar prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio. 

Este será su quinto crédito con MFP y se siente contento de saber que cuenta con este apoyo financiero. También agradece a su banco comunal por ser personas de palabra y que apoyan a cada socio. 
Con el préstamo de 3,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará prendas de vestir exclusivamente de la zona, con el resto comprará zapatos y sandalias.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 38 years old and lives in a house he is renting. He is a very hard working and persevering man, with a strong desire to get ahead. The business he has had for the past 8 years is selling clothing and shoes. He says he has done well in his business as a result of his strategy to treat his customers in a friendly way. He runs this business on his own. What he likes most about his work is that it allows him to have income as a result of working for himself. He told us that during the hot season is when he has more customers. For this reason it is his priority to increase the merchandise he has in stock. 

This will be his 5th loan he has taken out with MFP. He is happy to know he has this available as a form of support. He is thankful to his communal bank for being true to their word and for supporting each member. With the loan of 3,000 nuevos soles that he has requested he will buy clothing that is typical to the area, as well as shoes and sandals.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Rowena has a beauty salon that offers manicures and pedicures. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more materials needed in giving manicures and pedicures like nail cutters, nail polish, and acetone.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her services in order to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more nail polish and supplies to use for manicures.

loans.name: Dwighta

texts.en:
This is Dwighta, who is 55 and a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. Dwighta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also retails mineral water for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Dwighta hopes to be able to expand soon. 

Dwighta faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Genelita's Group

texts.en:
Genelita is 34 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 
Genelita has a seafood vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase additional seafood for her business. 
Genelita has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Genelita hopes to expand her business to other places. Genelita is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood for her business.

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en: Gleen comes from San Vicente, Sinacaban. She is engaged in the gardening business. She is 28 years old, married, and she works hard for the welfare of her child. She's been in this job for 2 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month. Recently, she joined GDMPC. She asks GDMPC Microcredit for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to improve her plantations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia used the previous loan to buy soft drinks and food for her restaurant. The 53-year-old widow still stays in Kagadi, Uganda. With the profits, she has been able to promptly pay school fees for her last born child. She has challenges such as inadequate capital to meet the different preferences of clients. Her dream is to have one of the biggest hotels in the area and a wholesale shop. Patricia intends to use this loan to buy food and general merchandise like sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.use: to buy food and general merchandise like sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, single, is 40 years old and resides at San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines. Jocelyn manages a garden area where she plants vegetables to earn a living. She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Recently, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Jocelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy is 40 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a business of purchasing junk materials to resell at the junk shop. He earns about $8 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Dy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son to run a taxi service. This purchase will help her son to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Elba Natividad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elba, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores y  el menor de 11 años de edad que estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga para poder ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar y aprovechando su arte culinario adecuo un restaurante en su casa, allí prepara deliciosos platos que son la delicia de sus clientes,  trabaja todos los  días y prepara desayunos y almuerzos, no prepara meriendas porque nos cuenta que se le hace muy cansado ya que desde las 5h00 se levanta a preparar los alimentos, además trabaja sola y ya en las tardes se dedica a descansar. Lleva tres años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres años y le gusta porque el primer crédito le ayudo para instalar su local. 
 
Su sueño es mejorar su local.
texts.en:
The Damas Del Futuro Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Pajan Canton, a canton known for being a livestock producing area of the province. One attraction is the Montubio Rodeo that is held at certain times of the year. 

It is here that we meet Elba. Elba is 51 years old and married. From this marriage, she has three children, two adults and one 11-year-old who is in school. Two of their children still live at home. Elba's husband is a shopkeeper.

To be able to help her husband with household expenses and take advantage of her culinary talents, Elba opened a restaurant in her house. There, she prepares delicious dishes that are the delight of her customers. She works every day and prepares breakfasts and lunches. She doesn't serve dinners because, she says, she gets very tired given that she gets up at 5 a.m. to prepare the meals. Plus, she works alone, so she takes the afternoons off. She has had her business for three years, and it's going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for the preparation of the meals. She has been in the Communal Bank for three years and she likes it because the first loan helped her set up her restaurant.
 
Her dream is to improve her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, fish, and other provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Baasandorj

texts.en:
Baasandorj is 40 years old, has two sons, and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia, which lacks basic infrastructure.  He works as a plumbing repairman while his wife works at a cashmere company. 

Since last year, he has managed his current house rebuilding project. He requested his previous loan for bricks for the house. Now he wants to work on the interior; thus he is requesting a 1,400,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase wallpaper, paint, and other materials to finish his housing project. 

Baasandorj says, “When I finish my housing work, I will be proud of myself for giving my lovely family a very comfortable and safe living environment.”

loans.use: to finish his housing project.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Lorena has a shop that sells ready-to-wear (RTW) products like slippers, pants, sandals, and jackets. She has had this business for 10 years. Aside from that, she also operates a sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods and snacks. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more RTWs to sell, such as short pants, underwear, and men's wear.

Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear items to sell

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes is from the Ornlong Veng district, where she grew up.  She earns a living in the rice farming business. She has been in this type of business for many years. She is now 33 years old and is responsible for two single children who are attending local schools. Tes’s priority in life is to provide a good standard of living and a good education for her children. This encourages her to work tirelessly at the rice field from dawn to dusk. Falling rain in the early part of the rainy season is a sign for Tes to start growing her rice crops. 

Due to a lack of funds for operating expenses, Tes would like to request a loan from HKL to rent a tractor to till her land. Also, with the borrowed money she will purchase herbicides to help her rice crops. She believes that she will be able to have a fruitful harvest as a result of the loan. Tes plans to grow potatoes for extra income in the following season.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till her land and to purchase herbicides.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has one child.

Eduardo provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools such as a T-wrench and screw driver and to pay for gasoline for his motorcycle service.

Eduardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his services to support the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and to pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.en:
Maria Alicia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Maria Alicia has a shop that sells ready-to-wear products such as skirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more clothes to sell such as jackets, pants and underwear.

Maria Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Maria Alicia hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey, 45, is a humble villager, who has been living with her family in a small village in Ornlong Veng district. She is married to a local farmer and has five single children. They still depend on their parents.  However, they can help manage the rice farming business during the rainy season.  Mey has been involved in the agribusiness for a long time and she has obtained enough experience to maintain her business well.  Aside from farming, Mey devotes herself to making and selling kindling to local people for extra profit. 

To further develop the two businesses, Mey is now taking out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to rend a tractor to till her land.  Also, with the remaining amount, she will purchase a kind of resin for the purpose of making kindling.  She is very happy and thankful for the constant support of our lenders to improve her business as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to rend a tractor to till her land and purchase a kind of resin for the purpose of making her kindling.

loans.name: Diamond Group

texts.en:
Melchora is married with five children.  She is sixty years old and lives in Anonang Dumalinao ZDS.

Her business is raising pigs for selling, that helps her to earn a living.  She earns PHP 4,000 each month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase new piglets. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to have her own piggery.

loans.use: to purchase new piglets.

loans.name: Ruziboi

texts.ru: Рузибой трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 4 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота и выращивания сельхозкультур. Имеет достаточно богатый опыт в скотоводстве. Его заботливая жена помогает ему по бизнесу. Рузибой хотел бы получить займ для покупки 4 голов крупного рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи. От полученной прибыли Рузибой намерен улучшить свое домохозяйства.  Он и его жена надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам!
texts.en: Ruziboi is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and raising two children.  Ruziboi has been involved in buying and selling livestock and growing agricultural crops for over four years.  His caring wife helps him with the business.  Ruziboi wants to obtain this loan to buy four heads of cattle for fattening up and resale.  Ruziboi intends to improve his household with the obtained profit.  He and his wife rely on your help and thank you in advance!

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viand.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as committed, determined, and intelligent. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services, such as plaiting, blow drying, etc. She provides other services such as manicure and pedicure. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in an urban area and her customers are primarily women. She describes her biggest business challenge as sometimes having a few customers who come for services. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern. Earlier, Veronica requested a loan of KES 20,000, which she managed to pay off well. Her business goal is to be running another beauty salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Keum

texts.en: Keum is 35 years old. She is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband runs the delivery service and tilling service. In order to improve her husband’s business, Keum is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a new walking tractor for her husband to run the service. This purchase will help her husband earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a new walking tractor to run the service

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with 5 children. Angelina is 46 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.
Angelina sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for Php 14,900.00 to be used for purchasing fishing nets and other materials.
Angelina has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Angelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Persenio

texts.en:
Persenio is widowed with 5 children. He is  59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Persenio is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He is requested a loan of 10000 to purchase more fertilizers for his farm. 

Persenio has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. in the future, he hopes to buy a parcel of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers for her farm

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Srey Mom is 40 years old. She is widowed and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for more than twenty years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. Approximately, she earns $3 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $7 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Srey Mom is requesting a loan of $1400 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie is 29 years old, married and has three children. She is a resident of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Three years ago, Gerlie started selling spare auto parts and tires and earns a monthly total of 6,000 PHP. In 2011, Gerlie became a GDMPC member. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Gerlie hopes to sustain her family’s livelihood and plans for other business ventures to generate a better life for them.

loans.use: to purchase vehiche spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products like hair color, nail polish and hair medicine

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a widower who is 76 years old. He has three children, all of whom are married and more than 30 years old. He earns his living through bicycle repairs and has been in operation for the past 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,500.  

He is taking his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and hopes to use this loan to purchase bicycle spare parts for his business.  

The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and his future dream is to start a transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: На протяжении 10 лет Толиб занимается купле- продажей скота. Он трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин, который на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Кроме скотоводства Толиб занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Отходы от выращивания идут на корм скота. Толиб хочет расширить свой бизнес и на полученную прибыль хочет сыграть свадьбу своего сына. В бизнесе помогают супруга и сын. Толиб запрашивает займ для покупки двух голов быка с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Tolib has been involved in buying and selling livestock for ten years.  He is a hardworking and kind family man, who is raising one child.  Besides animal husbandry, Tolib is involved in growing agricultural crops.  The leftovers from growing crops go toward feeding livestock.  Tolib wants to expand his business and hold a wedding for his son with his obtained profit.  His wife and son help him with the business.  Tolib is requesting this loan to buy two heads of bulls in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Enkhbaatar is a 52-year-old retired paymaster, who lives with his spouse and daughter in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, which lacks basic infrastructure. His daughter is a teacher who specializes in psychology. 

His current house was built 10 years ago. Now it needs renovation, because the house has become old and poor. Before the rainy season, he plans to re-cover the roof and then enlarge the storeroom (depot) and do some interior work, because when it’s raining outside, it drips from under the roof. It’s really hard to live in when it’s leaking.  

Thus, Enkhbaatar is requesting a MNT 1,500,000 (Mongolian Tugrik) loan to purchase roofing materials, wood, wallpaper, and other necessary construction materials for his housing work.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to protect his house from rain.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is aged 60 and married with three adult children. She has been in farming for forty years and reiterates farming has been her sole source of income in all her adulthood. Her farm currently produces cabbages, beans, maize and milk which she sells to the local market.

Agnes has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter to help her with the feeding of her dairy cows. She hopes this will help the cows and increase her milk produce to one hundred litres per day which will be used to feed the family and meet other basic needs.

She says the major challenge is in access of funds. She is glad though Juhudi Kilimo is mitigating the challenge.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom is 38 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs the business of purchasing generators to resell for a profitable price. Approximately, he earns $5 per day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Rom is requesting a loan of $1400 to raise capital in her husband‘s business for purchasing more generators to resell. This money will help her husband expand his business and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to earn extra income for the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital in her husband's business for purchasing more generators to resell

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is a 50-year-old mother of six chilren and she lives with her husband and her children in a village of the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. Five out of her six children are still in school while the other one is working in Thailand for pay. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who grow rice on the one-hectare farmland and grow bean on one hectare of farmland. They also supplements their income by planting vegetables such as cabbage, salad etc. They have been in vegetables business for almost twenty years while in rice farming and bean business for three years. With her current business, she can earn up to 190,000 Khmer Riel per day and save around 56,000 each for the future needs. 

This is the first loan for Saroeun with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables seeds for her vegetables business and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn larger income to build on her savings to spend for children's education and to build a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy vegetables seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 33 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 11 years. She describes herself to be social, customer-friendly and a good mother. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as flour, bread, sodas, sweets, sugar, cereals, tomatoes etc  .In addition, she runs a M-pesa retail shop. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located near a school  and her primary customers are students, village dwellers, teachers and tutors . She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payment from the customers . She will use the Kes 5800 loan to purchase a solar lamp . Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop and venture into another M-pesa retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will give her children the best education .

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Ganjuurjav

texts.en:
Borrower Ganjuurjav is married, 30 years old and has two sons.  He lives with his family in the outer ger district, which lacks the basin infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

In 2005-2011 he worked at a car spray-paint stall at the local market.  Then he decided to operate it on his own so he supports his family by operating a car spray-paint business since 2011. 

Recently he bought a car with all his working capital therefore he now needs to increase his capital.  In the summertime most of the car owners want to paint the outside of their car, thus Ganjuurjav’s business is very beneficial during this time. 

So Ganjuurjav is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase a variety of car spray-paints in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of paintings to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with six children. 

Mary Jane has a food and retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. Aside from that, she also operates a tailor shop that makes sporting attire and school uniforms. She has had this business for nine years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en: Tungalagtamir is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver, and her two oldest daughters are in school. She started her flour sales business in 2002 by renting a counter in market. Than in 2009 she started her garment retailing business. Her business has been expanding constantly ever since she opened the business. Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more garments. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "Now that my children are old enough, I need to concentrate on my business."

loans.use: To purchase more garments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 40 years old, living in Ornlong Veng district, where she and her husband have been operating a rice farming business to earn a living. This couple raises their two children in a small village. Despite their hardships and difficulties, they have determination to pursue a quality of life and provide a further education to their children. 

And now, Lay has turned to HKL for her second time to borrow a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to pay for the plowing fees and to purchase gasoline and lubricant oil for farming purpose. This loan will enable her to make sustainability to her business. She hopes to have a good outcome in the coming season. For her business goal, Lay would like to buy extra farmland to expand her business and increase her rice production.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fees and to purchase gasoline and lubricant oil for farming purpose.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a farmer in Murang’a and has practiced farming for twenty years. Her farm mainly produces maize, beans, milk and bananas which she sells within the local market to meet family needs. Her farming income is supplemented by her second hand clothes business.

Eunice has made a loan request amounting to 80,000 KES .She will use the money to buy a water pump at 60,000 KES and water pipes at 20,000 KES which she will mainly use in irrigating her bananas plantation. She plans to set up a bigger and better boutique retail shop to help boost her farming.

She counts occasional dry spells and lack of funds as the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine  is married with five children and all go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells local brew from home on retail basis. She works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of shs 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy millet and cassava for making local brew.  She generates additional income through selling beer .Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of building commercial house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman.  She has four children with ages ranging from ten years to twenty-three years.  She describes herself as social, a village leader and a loving mother.  She operates a retail store and water vendor business where she sells water and items such as flour, bread, sodas, sweets, sugar, cereals,tomatoes etc. She has been involved in this business for fourteen years.  Her business is located near a school and her primary customers are students, village dwellers, teachers and tutors . She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payment from the customers.  

Annah will use the KES 5,800 loan to purchase a solar lamp . Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years.  She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and build rental houses with profits generated from her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria  es casada  tiene 40 años  de edad y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “La Inmaculada Concepción” grupo  conformado por  6  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Victoria   se dedica a la venta de comida en un restaurante, Victoria empezó este negocio con la idea de obtener mejores ingresos economicos, trabajó muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en dia tiene, ahora cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha mejorado su casa, sus hijos tuvieron educación. Victoria a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (leche, fideos, etc). Victoria cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los prestamos de edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en:
Victoria is married, 40 years of age and has three children of school age. She is currently a member of the “La Inmaculada Concepción” communal bank, which has six members all involved in various trade activities. 

Victoria sells food in a restaurant. She began this business to generate more income. This is a hard job but has got her to where she is today. She has loyal customers thanks to her effort and dedication, and has managed to improve her home and provide her children with schooling. 

Victoria has requested a new loan to buy supplies (milk, noodles, etc.). She plans to meet her goals through hard work and effort, and hopes that the EDAPROSPO loans will help her.

loans.use: To buy supplies (milk, noodles, etc.).

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a woman of two children, one of whom is in school while the other one is still very young. She operates a food stall which is located at her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Susan lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She aims at opening a hotel in future. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and her major challenge is price inflation of commodities. Susan joined Yehu to get loans.
With the loan of Ksh 10000, she plans of purchasing wheat flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.use: purchasing wheat flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a resident of Murang’a  in  Central Kenya and has been in active farming for thirty years producing mainly bananas, vegetables, milk and cereals which she sells to the local market.She is married with two children aged sixteen and six years. She says farming has been her source of business and she currently has a greenhouse.

Hannah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy  a generator she will use for pumping water into her farm and ensure her production runs even during low water seasons. She will use the  income  to educate her two children .

She plans to build a good relationship with Juhudi Kilimo. She however laments of poor weather conditions as part of the challenges she is facing.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en:
Nhoem is 52 years old, married and she has seven children, two daughters and five sons. She lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. Out of the seven children, she only has one child who is still in school. She earns a living through planting rice as her primary business. She has been in this business for almost thirty-three years now. As a rural farmer, she has challenged with the lack of working capital for her business. 

Nhoem's group consists of two members who are all female. She and her group member have been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles and they successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her make her living better. Currently, she can earn her daily income of up to 19,000 Cambodian Riel and manage to save around KHR9,000 per day. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a mother of two adult children.  She sells new clothes through door to door to her neighbors.  She has been in this business for the last six years and she dreams of opening a boutique in the future.  Zaituni has rented a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She joined Yehu to access some loans, and she describes food to be her greatest monthly expense.

Seasonality is the major challenge facing her business.  Zaituni plans to use the loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.
